campaign.story:
Treasures Of The Troll King: a MÖRK BORG Adventure is an RPG sewer-crawl adventure by Chris Bissette, with art by Johan Nohr.
Galgenbeck is palimpsest. Tumour. A city built on the ruins of itself. Beneath the sewers the bones of the old city fester.
The troll-king Niduk was exiled, driven into the depths to rot and die. Now twisted by hatred and rage he oversees the small domain he has carved for himself, in a forgotten chapel to a murdered god.
Why are you here? A lost bet? A doomed quest for silver? Boredom?
Does it even matter?
ALT: A digital mockup of an A5 paperback zine. The art shows the face of a troll, furry and black with a mouth filled with teeth that interact with the text between them in an unsettling way. Gold chains adorn the troll's horns and it wears a gold crown. The title reads "Treasures of the Troll King".
The crown will be gold foil. We don't need to say much more about that, do we?
MÖRK BORG is a blackened artpunk doomsday rpg  about miserable bastards and heretics enduring a bleak, dying world.  It's a doom metal album of a game. A spiked flail to the face. Rules  light, heavy everything else. It's made by Pelle Nilsson of Ockult  Örtmästare Games and Johan Nohr from Stockholm Kartell, and published by  Free League Publishing.
MÖRK BORG is copyright Ockult Örtmästare Games and Stockholm Kartell.
Treasures Of The Troll King is an independent production by Loot The Room and is not affiliated with Ockult Örtmästare Games or Stockholm Kartell. It is published under the MÖRK BORG Third Party License.
Treasures Of The Troll King is an adventure designed for one- or two-shot play. You'll need the MÖRK BORG core game to play it, unless you want to convert it to another system. I literally can't stop you doing that and have very little interest in trying.
The adventure will be published as an A5 saddle-stitched softcover zine. Internal pages are 135gsm silk and the cover is 250gsm silk with matt lamination and gold foil stamping on Niduk's crown. This is the same specification as The Wretched and will look and feel really nice. 
As well as the cover art, Johan Nohr has also produced internal artwork for Niduk, the Troll King - the main threat in the adventure. If you pledge, you'll probably get to see that in an update at some point.

ALT: A digital mock-up of an A5 zine open to a two page spread. The pages are black and spattered with red and yellow ink spots. The first paragraph starts with a large calligraphic letter G, in red.

The adventure takes place in two phases - a point crawl through the sewers beneath Galgenbeck in search of the sunken chapel that houses Niduk, the Troll King, and a location-based dungeon in the chapel itself.
During the adventure characters might encounter:
A pile of forgotten wishes at the base of a wishing well
 The Church of Forgotten Things, a sewer shrine to the discarded treasures of everyday life kept by a strange old man who has forgotten daylight
The finger collector, a strange denizen of the sewers who trades in digits
A forgotten god sealed inside the bells of the chapel, begging for release
You'll find a host of weird locations, harrowing creatures, and new Occult Treasures to drop into your game.
The dungeon portion of the book mimics the layout of Rotblack Sludge, the introductory adventure found in MÖRK BORG, so it's familiar and easy to use at the table.
There are no stretch goals or add-ons and just five standard reward tiers to keep things simple. What you see is what you get!
Finger Collector is for people who just want the PDF. You'll get an Itch download key and my thanks. £8.
Troll Hunter gets you the print zine with foil-stamped cover and a PDF copy of the adventure. The Kickstarter edition will be the only one with the foil stamping - future print runs won't have it. £15 plus shipping (to be collected later).
Supplicant To The King gets you the adventure in print and The God Of Many Faces, a trifold pamphlet adventure. I'll have more details about this in an update during the campaign.  You'll also get PDFs of them both. £20 plus shipping (to be collected later).
Treasure Hoarder gets you print and PDF copies of Treasures Of The Troll King and The God Of Many Faces, plus a double-sided poster with the cover art on one side and the dungeon map on the other. The poster will be printed at A3 and folded down to A5 when it ships. £33 plus shipping (to be collected later). UPDATE: There will now be the option of two posters. You get one as standard in this tier and will be able to choose which design you want, and will be able to add the second poster through the Loot The Room store after the campaign ends if you want both.
Keeper Of Occult Secrets is the expensive tier for people who want to help out and have money to burn. Identical to the Treasure Hoarder tier, but I'll write additional content by hand in 66 copies of the zine. This could be new occult treasures, additional encounters, more adventure hooks, or something else entirely. Every copy will be unique - I won't repeat content. £66 plus shipping (to be collected later).
 What's that other tier? 
Sewer Crawler is a premium tier for people with money to burn who want me to run the adventure for them.
Chris Bissette is a musician and ENnie-nominated game designer from Manchester. Their solo journaling game The Wretched was selected as on of Tabletop Gaming Magazine's 'Best Games of 2020' and has spawned hundreds of games using it's Wretched & Alone engine. Freelance work includes The Gauntlet (Brindlewood Bay), Hunters Entertainment (Gods of Metal: Ragnarock), and more. Find them on Twitter @pangalactic.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All the text is written and layout is complete on the main zine - barring any playtest feedback - and Johan has provided me with both pieces of art. I still need to do layout for The God Of Many Faces once it's back from editing, but it's small and that won't take long at all.
This will be my 4th Kickstarter. I'm used to running them and fulfilling them. I also run a webstore and a Patreon that I release regular print games through. I work with my printers regularly and my fulfilment process is well-practiced.
Obviously there is still a global pandemic happening, so printing and shipping might be delayed, I might fall ill - anything could happen, really. The risk is minimal, though, and if you've backed my campaigns before you'll know I write regular updates and try to be as transparent as possible if delays occur.

updates.update_content: The zines arrived this afternoon and they look incredible. I'm super happy with how these have turned out.

Just a quick update.
I'm slowly getting through all the emails. If you've emailed me and haven't had a response yet - I'm getting to it, and I appreciate your patience.
In good news, the God Of Many Faces pamphlets and the posters arrived today!

Good morning!
Every Kickstarter I run comes with lessons and this one is no different. I'd often wondered why nobody ever uses Kickstarter surveys to distribute download keys. Now I know the answer.
My goal was to get you your downloads quickly. Rather than sending out surveys, waiting a suitable amount of time for everybody to respond, generating keys, distributing them, and then having to keep checking Kickstarter for the next few months to make sure late survey replies also got their downloads, I thought it would be easier for everyone if the surveys contained links to the PDFs.

Apologies for the second update so quickly after the last one!
It's come to my attention that surveys aren't viewable again after you filled them out, which is a massive oversight on my part.
So here's the plan:
If you haven't yet filled out your survey, don't do it until you're ready to complete checkout and/or download your PDF.

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone!
It's been a big day at Troll King HQ. Kickstarter deposited the funds this morning, which means I've now paid for all of the physical products and printing will being very shortly. I expect it will be around 2 weeks before I receive everything, but I'm waiting for delivery dates from the printers (I'm using Mixam for the zines and pamphlets and Awesome Merch for the posters).

Hi everyone!
Kickstarter should be depositing the money from the project at some point this coming week. I have the order set up with Mixam and they've signed off on all the files (including the foil printing, which is always a bit of a faff to get right) and now I'm just waiting for the funds to hit so I can pay them and the printing can begin.
In the meantime, I thought you'd like a preview of how the final PDF will look! I can't remember what the original page count was now - 24 I think? - but the final thing is now 32 internal pages, meaning a 34 page PDF when you include the covers.

And as suddenly as it began, its done. I went into this project anxious that I wouldnt make the £1700 needed to produce the book, and I think it's safe to say we smashed that.
This project is going to change my life in some very real ways, so thank you from the bottom of my heart for the support you've shown me.
Here's what's going to happen next.
In the gutters of Galgenbeck, in the shadow of the Cathedral of the Two Headed Basilisks, rumours spread like cancer...
After I shared Johan's art of Niduk the other day, a few people indicated they'd be interested in having that on a poster. So, I've made that happen.

campaign.story:
LORD: a MÖRK BORG Adventure is an rpg adventure by Flamberga, a creative studio based in Rome, Italy. 
Prepare to wander through a nameless land fallen in misery after a long war and now occupied by a usurper warlord know as the Saint, learn about the Saint's plan and why this little strip of dirt seems so important for many powers.
With the help of numerous random tables, quests, maps, npcs and much more stuff, the players'll eventually decide what the fate of the land is going to be. 

The adventure will be both in english and italian. Click here for the italian version. 

Stealing the words of the MÖRK BORG creators: 
"MÖRK BORG is a blackened artpunk doomsday rpg  about miserable bastards and heretics enduring a bleak, dying world.  It's a doom metal album of a game. A spiked flail to the face. Rules  light, heavy everything else. It's made by Pelle Nilsson of Ockult  Örtmästare Games and Johan Nohr from Stockholm Kartell, and published by  Free League Publishing"

Here you'll find a full adventure, made to last for many games with a mysterious setting full of choices to be made, stories to be learned and enemies to slay. The adventure'll guide you through its mysteries by giving you all the tools you need: maps, places, enemies, npcs, dungeons, quests, objects and so on. Here's a summary of the contents:
 A complete adventure: learn about the Saint, the factions involved in the war and uncover the mistery of the nameless land.
 Random tables: always useful to engage with the setting (and have a laugh on the players misadventures)
 New classes: adapted to the setting itself
 New enemies: because they're never enough
 New objects: useful elements for both practical use and the understanding of the world's lore
Dungeons, maps, puzzles
 Npcs and factions: they'll offer sub-quests and stories: how you'll engage with that faction instead of another one will define the world's events and your place in it.
Every other unlocked stretch goal
Also, remember that, especially if you're going to be the game master, you'll need a MÖRK BORG rulebook to play. 


Prototype cover (not final)
 HOW TO PLAY IT
In many ways, actually.
LORD offers you a complete adventure and a detailed setting, along with all the elements listed above like classes, enemies, factions and so on. You can choose to play it just like a regular adventure or taking only what you like and use it in any way you prefer. Also, the nameless land setting can easily be used like the starting point of many other adventures, especially if we end up unlocking the stretch goals thought to help you as game master with your own creations inside this world. 
 PLEDGES 
At the end of the campaign, a survey will be sent to the backers asking in which language (italian or english) do they prefer to get their rewards. 
The OCCULT PACK, included in the "Warlord" pledge, is a collection of maps, dungeons and objects from the adventure, usable as a quick to get reference during your game sessions. The maps are both in GM and Players version. 
A last minute extra
Many backers asked for a PDF version of the OCCULT PACK and we finally decided to add it as a last minute extra! This is the only addon for the campaign and it'll also be available in the DriveThruRPG store when to project is ready!
-To choose the OCCULT PACK (PDF) go to the main page of the project and select the "Manage Your Pledge" or "Back This Project" button.
-Choose a pledge and then select the OCCULT PACK (PDF) addon. 
 1000€. LORD IS FOUNDED [unlocked]: good news, now you just have to wait and get it!
 2000€. LORD'S PAMPHLET [unlocked]: A section of the book full of tips about how to establish your domain inside the nameless land and become the new lord!
 3000€. UNDER THE ABBEY [unlocked]: a PDF-only mini adventure, available just for this Kickstarter  campaign and FREE for all the backers!

SHIPPING
Shipping will be handled by the DriveThruRPG Print-On-Demand service. Every backer who chose the printed version of the adventure (and the OCCULT PACK for the "Warlord" Pledge) will get codes to print at cost through DriveThruRPG with their premium color printing. This way you'll receive a discount that allows you to purchase the print format at the cost of printing, then input your own address and pay shipping charges during checkout.
Here's a link for the estimated shipping costs provided by DriveThruRPG.
LORD: a Mörk Borg Adventure is an independent production by  Flamberga and is not affiliated with Ockult Örtmästare Games or Stockholm Kartell. It is published under the MÖRK BORG Third Party License.
A huge thank you goes to Jason Shaw (AudinautiX) for the BLACK FLY music track used in the video. Check him out here.

To keep up with updates, follow Flamberga on social media: 
 Instagram:  https://www.instagram.com/flamberga.studio/ 
 Twitter: https://twitter.com/flambergastudio 
 Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/Flambergastudio 
 YouTube: https://youtu.be/primH9CS7dQ

updates.update_content:
Dear backers,
work's proceeding according to plan and within the established time frame. We just sent you a survey about which version (Italian or English) of your reward you'd like to receive; please answer it and send us your email address to avoid problems of any kind!

I'd like to remind you that all backers, regardless of the chosen rewards, will receive the "Under the Abbey" short adventure: it can be, if presented as a prequel, a good way to introduce your players to the main campaign's mood and to its key narrative themes. My goal is sending you the short adventure just before the release of LORD, or simultaneously. I will release more accurate informations about this as soon as I have more certain news.

333 backers! You're melting the basilisk inside my heart!
Dear backers, this is Gianluca, the voice behind the project and the hand upon most of the work for the book. I know it will sound redundant, but I really have to give you the most heartfelt thank you for supporting this project and being a real part in the creation of the (not so) lovely Nameless Land. And I'll probably end up thanking you again a bunch of other times in the following updates (sorry!).

Many of you asked for a PDF version of the OCCULT PACK, and we decided to listen to your request!
You can select it as an addon for whichever pledge level.
We know it is a last minute addition, but we'll also make it available on the DriveThruRPG store when the project is ready!

Finally the last stretch goal has been unlocked! Under the Abbey is a PDF-only mini adventure, available just for this Kickstarter campaign and FREE for all the backers! It's just our way of thanking all of you for your support!
"Almost a century has passed since the end of the war, and many things have changed since the Saint came to the Nameless Land. This old abbey, now a heap of abandoned ruins, was the home of a cult whose name is now forgotten. And then, so they say, a prison."

Looks like we're going deeper and deeper...
And I've heard strange rumors about what lies beneath the Nameless Land. You'll see!

We did it! The project is funded at 100%. Thank you all for your support. 
Now the goal is to present the best possible results to those who believed in the project.
In the meantime, there are still many days left before the end of the campaign, and as you can see there are (not so many) stretch goals: to minimize the risk of delays, the decision was to put a few but selected ones, all concerning further sections of the book!

After almost a day since the start of the campaign, we reached over the 70% needed for the project to be realized, and a huge thank you goes to all the people who believed in it and supported it. Flamberga starts as a little reality eager to grow, find a community of passionate people and make the best products possible, and here we are at the starting point. 
Keep an eye on the project page or the Flamberga social medias for previews and updates. Feel free to ask any questions you want.

campaign.story:
Engage in power struggles and build your crew’s reputation. Salvage and steal to survive and endure a ruthless universe. And above all, do anything you can to get that next job.
This sci-fi tabletop roleplaying game takes you to the grimy blue-collar future of a universe filled with risk, but also opportunity. DEATH IN SPACE presents a vision of space where technology is broken and dirty, and society is harsh and desperate. The player characters make up a crew with their own spacecraft or station, and take on the jobs they can find, in order to earn some well-needed bucks and get ahead in the power struggles of the stellar system. 
The people making this game are Christian Plogfors and Carl Niblaeus of Stockholm Kartell. With this Kickstarter, we hope to get the funds to print the core book for the game, which should contain everything you need to start playing. We want to continue making material for the game after the game is out, in the form of adventures and other material to use in your game. 
Follow us on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter or on the website. 

Here's a preview of what we hope the standard edition of the book will look like (the holographic foil is stretchgoal-dependent):
DEATH IN SPACE has its roots in the OSR scene, and follows similar design principles. In terms of setting and tone, inspiration comes primarily from the gritty science fiction of films like Outland and Prospect, classic westerns and the grimy future of early 80’s science fiction movies. 
It is a game about adventure and uncertain journeys out into the darkness of space, it is about you and your crew making a home of your spacecraft or station, in tough competition with everyone else, and most of all, it is about enduring in an abandoned frontier system where your only hope of surviving is to take any contract you can find, sometimes having to put your fate in your enemies' hands.
Inspiration
There are a lot of great and inspiring games out there. In terms of rules and approach, we have found inspiration in some form, large or small, in for example the following games (alphabetically listed): Coriolis, Into the Odd, Knave, Mothership, Mutant Year Zero, MÖRK BORG, Offworlders, Solar Blades & Cosmic Spells, Mutant  (1989 edition), Traveller. Out of these, MÖRK BORG, Knave and Coriolis deserve a special mention.
Most of the inspiration for the tone and feel comes from movies and series. Some of these, that have inspired elements of the setting in one way or another, are (alphabetically listed): 2001: A Space Odyssey, A Fistful of Dollars, Alien, Blade Runner, Escape from New York, The Expanse, Firefly, IO, Moon, Outland, Prospect, Sunshine, Total Recall, The Warriors. 
Visually, much of the inspiration comes from abstract geometric art and design, and old computer interfaces and manuals.

In terms of music, one of our stretchgoals consists of a dedicated soundtrack for the game, by our musician collaborator Helium Kid Kanon. You can already listen to a preview of what that will sound like on Spotify (or scroll down to the stretchgoal list and listen immediately). 


Standard edition with holographic foil (not final)
Kickstarter exclusive edition (not final)
Our main goal is to print a durable book of excellent quality that is easy to use at the table. We aim for an offset printed book with a sewn binding and possibly some fancy extras, depending on which stretchgoals are funded.
The book should land at about 128 pages and measure 6 by 9 inches. You can choose from two cover versions: the standard cover, and a special edition, only available in the Kickstarter.
Regarding the covers, we plan for the special edition to be a cloth bound book, and the regular edition cover to be embellished with holographic foil (the silvery kind with reflecting colors), if we fund the corresponding stretchgoal (otherwise, the holographic parts will be a solid color). Apart from that, there are more possible upgrades to the book in stretchgoals. Basically, we don’t want to pull any punches, and will try to make this as nice a book as possible.
Contentwise, the core rulebook contains everything you need to start playing immediately:
 Light-weight rules, intended to be easy to use and quick to learn
  A system for quickly generating player characters and their spacecraft or space-station
   60+ different modules to make the spacecraft or space-station your own
  An introduction to the default setting, the Tenebris stellar system, its main locations and history (with many pieces of the puzzle left for you to fill in)
  A system for repairs, where you collect spare parts to repair your stuff
   20 cosmic mutations, representing physical manifestations of the void through your body
  A system for spacecraft confrontations and boarding
  An introductory scenario to jumpstart your campaign
   40+ tables and generators packed with setting flavor
Below are some preliminary spreads to give you a flavor of how the interior of the book will look like:
The rules of DEATH IN SPACE are intended to be easy to use and hack but also to support and introduce the setting through the rules. While inspired by OSR games, the primary intent is not to be fully compatible with the rulesets and modules of old, but rather to try to capture the quickness and simplicity of these rulesets, tweak them according to our preferences and add some setting flavor (however, the rules are still close enough to other OSR rulesets that material should be possible to use with some simple conversions).
The basic rule when you try to accomplish something, say force open an airlock, or resist the effects of strange radiation, is to roll a d20 modified by one of four ability values, the ability determined by the nature of the task. If you roll over a fixed difficulty, you succeed. Failing checks gives you void points that you can use to increase your chances the next time you attempt something. Beware of saving up too many though, that might result in some nasty consequences. Void points are also used to activate cosmic mutations, strange powers from the void. 
The player characters are all part of a crew with their own spacecraft or space-station, their sanctuary in a dangerous universe. Characters are generated in a quick randomized fashion, making it quick to make a new one when (not if)  your character suffers an accident. With a list of 60+ modules that provide new possibilities, the players can successively customize their ship or station and really make it their home and base of their adventures. If your ship or gear should break, you can repair it as soon as you collect the necessary spare parts. In case you encounter rivals on your travels, the rules for spacecraft confrontations determine the outcome and whether you can avoid being boarded.
DEATH IN SPACE focuses on the Tenebris system—a system of planets and objects revolving around the star Tenebris. It is a stellar system ravaged by war and strife, where a greed-fueled mining for precious gems ended in a conflict that laid waste to the intricate trade networks that ensured technological production. With no new parts to find, almost every single object built today, from weapon to spacecraft, is put together from discarded, salvaged or stolen parts. Nothing is new.
As if rebuilding the system after the war was not enough, there are reports from stargazing cosmologists that the universe has stopped expanding, and that it has instead begun collapsing at an accelerating rate. The news that civilization is at its end have created a sense of hopelessness and disorder, and in many sectors of the system former vassals have taken this chance to seize control from distant rulers.
Player spacecraft concept by Mattias Astenvald
In the heart of the Tenebris system is the Iron Ring—a huge, ring-like structure surrounding the moon Inauro like a belt of metal. This is the center of activity in the Tenebris system, and here miners and salvagers huddle in cramped living quarters, waiting for their next contract and a chance to earn some much needed money. In other parts of the Ring, far from the bustling market-places and common areas, there are dark, empty sectors, where shady types hide from attention.
Among the people of the Iron Ring, cryptic rumors are spreading about a void accelerating the collapse. A void that whispers strange sentences to the unlucky through the ever present thick static noise that grows stronger and stronger as you travel towards the edge of civilization. A void that infects and corrupts and imbues their bodies with odd powers.
In the middle of all this are the player characters: hard-working explorers and laborers hoping for a big score.
The 99% Void Safe reward level
Void protection. With this reward level you get the core book in print, with the cover of your choice (regular or special edition). The book will be wrapped in foil, to keep it safe from the strange void radiation. Better safe than sorry. 
This is a mockup and not the final product.
T-shirt. Premium cotton t-shirt from Spreadshirt. We're aiming for a design based on the book cover.
Handouts. Two maps for the adventure in the core book—Welcome to the Ring—printed on high quality paper. 
Stickers. One prismatic sticker portraying the spacecraft by Mattias Astenvald, and one holographic sticker using the graphics from the standard cover. These designs are exclusive for the Kickstarter. Below are preliminary designs.
Setting location and printed note. We create a location connected to the Iron Ring—an establishment, a station, spacecraft or similar—and dedicate it to you. The locations are planned to be included in a table in the book. You get an individually crafted and printed thank-you letter that also includes the location name and description. 
50000 SEK – We make this book 
A high-quality offset printed 128-page book including all you need to start playing.
75000 SEK – Holographic foil cover
We add holographic foil to the regular book cover and make this book glimmer.
100000 SEK – Soundtrack
We ask our musician collaborator Helium Kid Kanon to make a full-length soundtrack for DEATH IN SPACE, that you can use as background music for your games. Every backer gets the soundtrack digitally, and it will also be made available on Spotify and Bandcamp. Here is how Helium Kid Kanon describes the soundscape for DEATH IN SPACE:
"Sound waves from dark, vibrating aegrine were found on a 570 million year old, volcanic island. When passed through a cloud chamber, they turn into an oozing, analog warmth, layered with sparkles of cosmic noise. These are some of the parts, arranged into a multi layered space. A composition that can trigger chronesthesia. The soundscape for DEATH IN SPACE."
 150000 SEK – Pamphlet adventure
We make a pamphlet adventure. All backers get it in pdf form and we include it in print with all rewards except Orbit Vagabond and Event Horizon Diver.
200000 SEK – More illustrations
We add more spacecraft illustrations by artist Mattias Astenvald to the book.
250000 SEK – Map poster
We make a map poster of the Tenebris system. For the map, we will receive some help from graphic designer and animator Gabriel Herrin. Gabriel did some work on the movie Prospect – one of the big sources of inspiration for DEATH IN SPACE – so we are very happy to have him onboard! All backers get it in pdf form and we include it in print with all rewards except Orbit Vagabond and Event Horizon Diver. Note that logos are placeholders and will be replaced.
300000 SEK – Bookmark ribbon 
We add a bookmark ribbon to the book, to make it easier to find the page you’re always flipping to.   
350000 SEK – More illustrations
We add even more spacecraft illustrations by our artist Mattias Astenvald to the book.
500000 SEK – New adventure
We ask Rickard Antroia to write an adventure for us. The adventure will be released in pdf and all backers get it digitally. Rickard is a writer and designer who has written adventures for Coriolis and Tales from the Loop and worked with editing on Tales from the Loop, Things from the Flood, Vaesen and Alien RPG. He wants to take you on an epic journey to the edge of the universe.
700000 SEK – Cults and factions
Pelle Nilsson - from Ockult Örtmästare Games, author of games such as MÖRK BORG and Barkhäxan among others, contributes to the game by providing a number of cults or factions of the Tenebris system that you can use in your game.

800000 SEK – Online generator 
We ask Karl Druid to make an online character generator for us. Karl writes material and makes virtual paraphernalia for tabletop RPGs. He is for example behind the MÖRK BORG online generators scvmbirther and dngngen.  

900000 SEK – Printed pamphlet #2 
We print the adventure pamphlet by Rickard Antroia from the 500k stretch goal. All backers with physical reward levels get it (all reward levels except Orbit Vagabond and Event Horizon Diver). This means that if you get the printed book, you get two different printed adventure pamphlets with it.

1,100,000 SEK – Solar Fields song and Tenebris system soundscape
Magnus Birgersson, also known under the name Solar Fields, will write and produce a track inspired by the material included in the book! Solar Fields has released 17 albums and appeared in over 60 compilations, including the in-game scores for the computer games Mirror's Edge and Mirror's Edge Catalyst. You can find his music on Spotify and on other platforms.   
In addition, if we pass this stretchgoal, Helium Kid Kanon will create a number of immersive soundscapes that represent various locations and environments in the Tenebris system. A perfect background to amplify your experience while exploring our world.  
The songs for the soundtrack and the soundscapes will be published on streaming platforms like Spotify, and backers get them digitally.
The majority of the money we collect will fund the printing cost for the book and any other funded print material. The remaining funds will be used to pay our collaborators for their work and costs. 
DEATH IN SPACE will be published by Free League Workshop, Free League Publishing's sublabel for externally designed games. They are responsible for shipping and distribution.
We plan to use a pledge manager, and charge shipping separately after the campaign has ended. See the map for our current best estimates of shipping costs*. The current plan is to ship the game from the UK as the default, but with distribution hubs in the EU and US as well. 
* This is based on shipping one book, the map and a pamphlet, and the Moon Outlaw and 99% Void Safe reward levels may therefore incur some extra shipping charges

Christian Plogfors. When he is not writing for DEATH IN SPACE, Christian spends the rest of his time on the layout and graphics for the game. He has been designing worlds for computer games for 18 years, now as a senior level designer, and has contributed to games such as Battlefield, Mirror’s Edge and Star Wars Battlefront. When relaxing, he likes to write material for his Into the Odd hack Into the Jungle. He has also contributed with material and layout for the Night Yeast zine.
Carl Niblaeus. While almost every sentence of the game has been dissected by both Carl and Christian, Carl has had the last word on much of the language in the book. In the RPG world, Carl has contributed to MÖRK BORG zine Feretory, the Night Yeast zine, and released one or two old school modules before that. He also helps running the so-called Old School Corner (“Old School-hörnan”) at GothCon, Sweden’s largest RPG con. There he referees his own and others’ creations. Outside of RPGs, Carl has a PhD in astroparticle physics, and has spent many years researching the underpinnings of our own universe. In DEATH IN SPACE, this knowledge is used to inspire the creation of another.
Collaborators
Apart from us there are a number of collaborators who provide invaluable assistance in making the game.
Johan Nohr. As one half of the team behind MÖRK BORG, Johan should be well-known to many in our audience. With MÖRK BORG, he works tirelessly to make it look as great as it does, and we are very happy to have him onboard. In DEATH IN SPACE, Johan has worked with the illustrations, adding touches to give them a more personal feel.
Mattias Astenvald. Mattias is an artist located in Uppsala, Sweden, working in the digital gaming industry. For our game, he helps make reality of our spacecraft and we hope to make use of his great skills as much as we can. 
Gabriel Herrin. Seattle-based graphic designer and animator. Gabriel did some work on the movie Prospect, which is one of the big sources of inspiration for DEATH IN SPACE, so we're really happy have him onboard. He will help us make company logos for the map poster. Check out more of his stuff here.
Stockholm Kartell is a creative coven of writers, designers and idiots. A group of friends who play and sometimes make games together.

https://www.deathinspace.com/
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While this is our first Kickstarter as creators, we have the experience of Free League and the rest of Stockholm Kartell to help us make this project a reality. The game content is at the launch of the campaign about 90% complete, and we foresee no major changes after the campaign. After the campaign we want to spend about 2 months finalising the last few details before doing a proper round of editing and proofreading with a native English speaker. Our plan is then to deliver the game to the printer in September, which should provide enough time for the game to be in your hands by January 2022. 

Given the experience of Free League Publishing, we feel confident that printing, stocking and shipping will be in safe hands, and we will do our utmost to make sure that you will have your books by January! However, unforeseen things can always happen, and we will make sure to communicate any such delays or issues.

Hi everyone!
Here’s a small update on what's going on. Since last time, we have mostly kept working on finalizing the contents of the book. We have closed the chapter on rules, and are now working on all the tables and tools at the end of the book. 
We have also received some new art from Mattias Astenvald, that we can't wait to show everyone soon. One full spread showing a massive space station, and a smaller illustration of a spacecraft. And we have also received some great content from Pelle Nilsson, who is writing a couple of cults and factions for the book.

updates.update_userinfo: Pledgemanager is live + update from the studio
updates.update_content:
Wow, just wow! We are truly blown away by the huge level of support this campaign ended up with. THANK YOU! Thank you all so much for believing in this game that means so much for us.
We are now really excited to finish the last parts and get this game into your hands. We have tried hard to make a game that we want to experience and play ourselves, and now all of you have become a part of that. Thanks to your great support, we now have the possibility to make the game we wanted to make, and for this we are enormously grateful. And soon, it is your game too.

Alright, three days left now! Let’s keep our fingers crossed that we can clear that stretchgoal at 1.1M SEK!
We’ve had some questions about mechanics, and in this update we’ll go through the mechanics in a bit more detail, as they look now. Note that the rules are not completely finalized yet, and we’re still doing some playtesting, so some of what we write in this post may change. Most of it should remain about the same though.

Time for a short update. 
First something on stretchgoals: We have unlocked a second printed pamphlet! With that, we will now include a total of three adventures with the game—two pamphlets and one in the book.

We have also added a new stretchgoal. For us, music is a big part of playing and writing Death in Space, and if we pass this stretchgoal, we will get a soundscape by Helium Kid Kanon that represents various environments and locations of the Tenebris system. In addition, this stretchgoal includes a track written especially for the game by the musician Magnus Birgersson, also known as Solar Fields. Solar Fields is an experienced musician who has released 17 albums and appears on 60 compilations, so we couldn't be more excited to hear what he will create.

Alright, time for an update! We’ve been a little quiet for a few days, but in case you haven’t noticed, we have cleared a couple of stretchgoals since our last update, and added a couple of new ones. In Sweden we have had some days off for Easter, and it’s been good to have some time to think about the route ahead and to start working on content for the game again.
Let’s talk about what we have cleared:

updates.update_content:
We're still not sure whether we've landed on our feet yet after yesterday, but we are incredibly grateful for the support. With 500k SEK in funding, we just cleared a stretchgoal for an adventure (in pdf) by Rickard Antroia. This will be the third adventure included. 

Rickard is the main designer behind the recently released campaign module The Last Cyclade for the Coriolis RPG and has been involved in other games such as Tales from the Loop, Things from the Flood and Vaesen. He likes to write about mysterious phenomena, rickety tech, fights for survival and conflicts where it is hard to choose a side.

Wow, we really smashed through those stretchgoals faster than light speed. As of now, we have already unlocked the bookmark ribbon and secured funding for more illustrations by Mattias Astenvald. And of course, we have unlocked both the pamphlet and map, both included in print for rewards which include physical stretchgoals.
For the map, we'll get some assistance by Gabriel Herrin, a graphic designer and animator who worked on the movie Prospect. We're really happy about this, given that Prospect has been a great source of inspiration when making the game!

campaign.story:
Illustrations by DC Stow. Animations by Zack Wolf.
Whoa there, friend! Indeed, you have come to the right place, but heed this warning: Venture not into these perilous realms of fantastic sword and sorcery, lest ye be of stout mind and steely nerve. For within these pages lie the gates to a wicked world of magic, mystery, devilry, and danger! 
Foul monsters and gleaming treasures await the courageous or foolhardy. Many will perish, but some cunning and lucky souls will rise to greatness. What adventure will you pursue? What terror will you face? What treasure will you uncover? Let us proceed to find out!
So, what are you waiting for? Be brave and stay sharp. Triumph is within your grasp, but it’s not safe to go alone. Gather your party and go forth to gold and glory!
THE TIME IS NOW.
YOUR ADVENTURE BEGINS HERE.
REALMS OF PERIL is a classic fantasy role-playing game presented as a pair of jam-packed zines lavishly illustrated by the amazing DC Stow.
📗 THE ADVENTURER'S FIELD GUIDE is a complete rulebook containing everything you need as a player to learn how to play, create unique adventurers, and advance your characters into powerful movers and shakers in the world. 70+ pages, spot color, soft-touch, staple-bound zine.
📘 THE GAME MASTER'S HANDBOOK is an indispensable reference manual for new and seasoned GMs full of clear and concise procedures, enlightening tips,  best-practices, and inspiring content to help every session come alive. 70+ pages, spot color, soft-touch, staple-bound zine.
Digital Mock-Up of the Zines
☠️ Simple but powerful d20-based core mechanic that encourage fiction-focused gameplay. Based on World of Dungeons by John Harper (creator of Blades in the Dark). Dice rolls determine not just success and failure, but whether you encounter cost, choice, or danger in your actions. Most dice rolls are player-facing.
☠️ Created from the ground up for open-persistent gameplay (aka West Marches). Based on the formative West Marches posts by Ben Robbins (creator of Microscope and Follow). Also inspired by the excellent Hack Attack videos with Steven Lumpkin and Adam Koebel, as well as Matt Colville's West Marches video.
☠️ Designed with OSR principles in mind, as prescribed by old-school luminaries such as Matt Finch, Ben Milton, Steven Lumpkin, David Perry, Patrick Stuart, Scrap Princess, and Chris McDowall.
☠️ Mechanics are designed to compliment West Marches style campaigns. Focuses on exploration of a sandbox-style hexcrawl map, an "open table" (no set cast of characters or static group of players) and a shared, persistent gameworld (the actions of one set of adventurers leave their mark for future adventurers to see). Features "flattened math" so fledglings and veterans can adventure together. Also provided are advice and tools for the GM to host their own open-persistent campaigns.
☠️ Gameplay is about exploration, interaction, tough choices, and survival more than slaying every monster or angling for an epic story every session. The story is created when we look back at what happened during a session.  
☠️ Minimal player-facing mechanics and simple character stats encourage creative problem solving over finding the solution on the character sheet. Spend more time talking about the fictional details than looking up complex rules.
☠️ Fast and evocative character creation driven by a list of 100 classic character backgrounds that provide interesting starting items and flavorful, bite-sized chunks of character background. 
☠️ Adventurers start as level 0 fledglings. Characters are simple to begin with and grow in complexity as they advance, creating a built-in learning curve for players. Easy to learn and teach, but deep enough to provide long-term engagement for players, suitable for full-length campaigns.  
☠️ Over a dozen compact but flavorful classes, all illustrated with iconic art. Each time you level up, assign a rank to one of the classes and gain a special feature from their list. Multiclassing is expected and encouraged. Combine classes to build the character you want to play. But remember, the real power can only be found out there, in the wild.
☠️ Several unique types of magic-users, each with their own thematic spells and strange abilities. Spells are about interesting utility more so than pure firepower.  A list of common spells is available to the players, while another set of mysterious and powerful "treasure spells" can be found in the GM's Handbook, only obtainable through discovery. More than 100 different spells in total. 
☠️ Hirelings, pets, followers, strongholds, establishments, downtime activities, and more. Ample peripheral content to bolster the party ranks and create extended options for play.
☠️ Guidelines for GMing that foster creative, interactive, old-school gameplay. Clear systems and procedures for the GM to run a session. 
☠️ Gameplay puts a focus on detailed descriptions of fictional events and "rulings over rules". The GM can use the core mechanic to resolve any roll, or they can fall back on a useful list of "methods" (PbtA-style moves) that help resolve specific types of actions when needed.
☠️ Assemble actionable quest goals for players from comprehensive lists of options, provided by Johnstone Metzger. Use the lists to build interesting objectives for adventurers looking to pursue more complex goals or projects.
☠️ 100+ classic and new magic items that focus on creative utility over bonuses and combat power. 
☠️ Plenty of classic and new monsters, beasts, and enemies to fight or run from. Monsters are scary because they're vicious, deadly, tough, and don't play by the normal rules - not because they have a lot of hit points. 
☠️ Conveniently split into two zines. Why? So the players can be creating characters with the Adventurer's Field Guide on their side of the table, while the GM can reference the Game Master's Handbook behind the screen.
☠️ Advice for asynchronous and online play. Run your open-persistent world on the internet or in person, with some simple guidelines to build your own adventuring community. 
UPDATE: Head over to our Discord to download the Playtest Version of the Adventurer's Field Guide: https://discord.gg/dRDqJTM

THE DIGITAL PACKAGE contains all content in PDF form, plus bonus digital content including: character record sheets, supplemental record sheets, campaign trackers, guild record sheets, hireling & pet sheets, hex mapping sheets, rules reference sheets, and more.
WHAT'S IN THE BOXED SET?
The custom 6x9 stout box will feature artwork by DC Stow and will comfortably hold both zines as well as all peripheral items:
 Character Sheet Pad: A pad 50 5.5x8.5, double-sided character sheets. Tear-away so you can easily hand them out to all of your players. 
 Inventory Sheet Pad: A matching pad of 50 5.5x8.5, double-sided supplemental sheets for bags, hirelings, pets, strongholds, spells, etc. Also tear-away.
 Item Card Deck: A set of 36 poker-sized cards with custom art on one side and all of the weapons, armors, and most useful items on the other sides. Useful so you don't have to worry about notating item properties. Includes tuck box.
 Dual GM Screens: A pair of medium-sized (16"x4.5") stand up GM screens displaying DC Stow art on the player-facing side, and useful system reference information on the GM-facing side. Two screen because they are smaller (to fit in the stout box) but we still want to make sure all the stuff you need is right there for easy reference. Without the GM screens, you can print out rules reference sheets for use during play.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This isn't our first expedition. Spellsword was awarded Kickstarter's "Backer Favorite" badge for a proven positive track record of completing and delivering a Kickstarter project. Check out our Kickstarter Profile!

The design and production process will be similar to our last Kickstarter project, The Evils of Illmire, so we can rely on that experience a lot to help ensure we can deliver. We're giving this project a longer timeline, mostly to account for copious amounts of artwork, playtesting, and editing. With no reason to anticipate further delays, we're confident in the delivery window.

Books will be printed by Mixam. They have been solid through the pandemic and deliver quick, high quality zines with minimal printing and cutting mistakes. Peripherals will be produced by reputable, US-based manufacturers.

I ship from HQ myself. Shipping will be through USPS. They have been highly reliable throughout the pandemic, successfully delivering over 700 zines over the past nine months, with only one reported damage (which I replaced promptly).
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Environmentally friendly factories
Mixam uses vegetable-based inks and recycle all waste products.
Sustainable Distribution

updates.update_content:
Greetings people of the realms! 
Happy April! I hope everyone is doing well, staying safe, and enjoying the springtime :)
After a bit of rest and recuperation during May, progress has been steady over the past few weeks. Many of the suggestions and alterations offered by folks over on the RoP Discord have been folded in and incorporated. Thanks all for your help!

updates.update_userinfo: We did it! Realms of Peril is coming! Thank you all so much for the incredible support!
updates.update_content:
Wow! Just... wow! This whole experience has been incredibly humbling! ❤️
I am flabbergasted at the level of amazing enthusiasm and encouragement that everyone has shown for this project. We smashed all expectations and then kept going! This is a dream come true for us and we are elated to deliver the most fun and accessible game we can!

A HUGE thank you to the growing community, who has shown nothing but positivity and has been a great source of reassuring and helpful discussion! You guys are AWESOME and your participation fuels our fire!

campaign.story:
The House of the Hollow is a one-shot adventure, in zine form, for the tabletop role-playing game: MÖRK BORG. Inside, players will investigate a mysterious moonlit manor - home to a retired adventurer in the midst of a terrible transformation.
Cover design (not final)
On the brink of collapse, navigating the decrepit house provides a challenge in and of itself - not to mention the moon-bound horrors lurking between its walls. A haunting revelation awaits travelers who enter the mansion, along with a powerful artifact ripe for the plucking.
This zine is designed as a quick adventure that can be easily dropped into an existing campaign. The layout focuses on high accessibility, low preparation, and ease of use at the table. Inspired by OSR (Old School Renaissance) sensibilities, this adventure is deadly, player-driven, and requires creative problem-solving to succeed.
Inside, you’ll find:
 A complete adventure for your doomed adventurers
 Original illustrations to inspire their demise 
 Adventure hooks to get the blood flowing
 Horrifying creatures to challenge their sanity
 Puzzles to test their wits
 Magic items to make it worth their while

Example spread
In keeping with the vision of Zine Quest, The House of the Hollow will be printed as a black and white 5.5” x 8.5” (A5) stapled booklet. It will be approximately 20 pages long (total page count not final), including the full-color cardstock cover.
 $3 - Digital Edition (PDF) - Get The House of the Hollow digital PDF version along with any digital stretch goals.
 $10 - US Print Edition + PDF - Get The House of the Hollow in physical print form and the digital version + any stretch goals. Shipping is FREE, but this pledge level is for backers with a U.S. ADDRESS ONLY! 
 $5 - International Print-on-Demand Code + PDF - Get a code to purchase the zine (at cost) on DriveThruRPG along with the digital edition. This pledge is meant for non-US residents who want a print version. Shipping will be charged separately through DriveThruRPG, with costs depending on your location.
While this adventure is not designed with expandable content in mind, I still want to improve the quality of the zine as funding increases.  With that in mind, the Stretch Goals I have planned will focus on physical print quality improvements (for the US print version) and homebrew content I've been developing and use in my own campaign.

✅  $750 - Upgraded Cover Quality: 100 lb -> 110 lb weight paper.
✅ $1000 - Upgraded Paper Quality: 70 lb -> 80 lb weight paper.
✅ $1500 - Upgraded Paper Coating: Gloss -> Uncoated (textured) paper.
✅ $2500 - Rewards Table: A useful table for quickly generating loot on the go!
✅ $3500 - Further Upgraded Cover Quality: 110 lb -> 130 lb weight paper.
✅ $5000 - The Hamlet Module: Invest in the local economy and reap rewards in this  rogue-lite progression system.
The adventure design and art are roughly 80% finished, with the bulk of the remaining work consisting of layout and editing. The dates below are estimates but I’m confident that I can deliver the rewards on time:
 Feb: Kickstarter finishes, backers are charged. Continued tuning on the adventure.
 Mar-Apr: Final print versions are prepared and sent off to the manufacturer. The manufacturer ships printed zines to me. Final PDFs are sent out.
 Apr-May: U.S. addresses are locked in and fulfillment begins for the U.S. print edition.
 May-June: After US fulfillment, the international version is uploaded to DTRPG for international backers. A print-proof will be ordered to check quality. Pending approval, the international print orders will open shortly after.
** Note: all rewards are intended to be fulfilled in 2021 (despite what the rewards tier says)
What is MÖRK BORG ? Take it from the the creators themselves:
MÖRK BORG is a blackened artpunk doomsday RPG about miserable bastards and heretics enduring a bleak, dying world. It's a doom metal album of a game. A spiked flail to the face. Rules light, heavy everything else. It's made by Pelle Nilsson of Ockult Örtmästare Games and Johan Nohr from Stockholm Kartell, and published by Free League Publishing. Check it out here, you might like it.
The House of the Hollow is an independent production by Dylan Mangini and is not affiliated with Ockult Örtmästare Games or Stockholm Kartell. It is published under the MÖRK BORG Third Party License.

About the creator
Dylan is a graphic designer, illustrator and game designer from the Pacific Northwest. His work can be seen in board games such as: Point Salad, Calico, Truffle Shuffle, Cascadia, Dollars to Donuts and Mephisto (self published). He also designs tabletop gaming themed apparel seen on Teebletop.com. This project represents his first foray into the world of tabletop RPGs - a passion he discovered during the pandemic.

Thanks for stopping by!

campaign.story:
The Vaults of Torment: Blood is Fuel is a 3rd party MÖRK BORG compatible dungeon, filled with sick monsters and unnecessary cruelties—written by me, Christian Eichhorn.
tl;dr: All reward tiers only include a digital PDF. I'm planning to release a POD version which all tiers can buy at printing cost + shipping.
Backers will get their PDF through DriveThruRPG and I'm looking into releasing on Itch.io. Regarding a printed version: I'm laying the dungeon out for print and I want to send every backer a DTRPG code to print at cost plus delivery. Because I haven't done this before, because of the general COVID/BREXIT situation, and because I don't know how big the dungeon will get, I don't want to make a printed version an official backer reward. But rest assured, I want to hold a print in my hands as much as you.
Blood is Fuel. Blood is Fuel. Blood is Fuel. Blood is Fuel. Blood is Fuel.
The Vaults of Torment are a cursed dungeon network, originally built as a debtor's prison. Demons that sprung from the incarcerated's minds expanded the tunnels, made the prison their playground, and the prisoners their playthings. 
Push forward into the depths of this depravity and uncover the secrets of the vaults. Maybe you survive and win your freedom. Or you become part of the menagerie.
Level 0. Welcome to Hell.
You want to know about me? Well, I'll take it as a compliment. I spent the last three years of my life writing D&D 5e content almost exclusively published on the DMsGuild (https://www.dmsguild.com/browse.php/?author=Christian%20Eichhorn) [you have to copy the bloody thing, it just won't work otherwise it seems]. My fingers are bloody stumps and my brain is filled with dark ideas. For now, I fuel the dungeon. Later, you.
In the before time, I was a corporate lawyer. But work felt like a prison and life senseless. I finally found my calling in writing TTRPG content.
To the most important thing: I was born in 86 and my favorite games are Fallout 1&2, Planescape Torment, Morrowind, Baldur's Gate 2, and the Icewind Dale series. You need not know more to know a person.
I have a newsletter right here if you want to stay informed beyond this Kickstarter (click).  
Otherworldly Demons and Distorted Husks
Monsters populate the dungeon. Some benign—a source for food or equipment. Most others, evil and deadly. Take a look at these abominations and despair. Dark Lore Masters may name the ones marked (?).
Geier God, Dust Angel, and (?)
Zombification: The imprisoned slowly become zombies. Might be reversed with special sacrifices.
Blood is Fuel: The Dungeonmaster can torment the characters with special abilities, using their own blood.
Tiles: Build your own dungeons from a retro tile set! More or less compatible in style with Dyson's work.
A work in progress of straight corridor tiles. More to come.
Legal
The Vaults of Tormen: Blood is Fuel is an independent production by Christian Eichhorn and is not affiliated with Ockult Örtmästare Games or Stockholm Kartell. It is published under the MÖRK BORG Third Party License.
MÖRK BORG is copyright Ockult Örtmästare Games and Stockholm Kartell.

Hey everybody!
If you haven't seen it already, you should have received a DTRPG code via your e-mail. A few important things:
1) A backer wrote to me just now that their code didn't work and that they couldn't redeem it because it was already redeemed once (I sent a new code, hoping it works). If you encounter the same error, please first leave a comment on this update. If this should be a general problem, I'll have to contact DTRPG to find a general solution. I hope it's just an insulated issue because, for me, it works fine.

Sigh. DTRPG just threw me a curveball. Here is the gist of it: effective from the 1st of July, the price of Premium Color PODs will increase by about 33%. Naturally, I set up the Vaults as Premium Color. This means the following:
Depending on when my proofing copy will arrive, there is a small window of opportunity to order a Premium Color POD before prices increase. I have no idea when my copy will arrive though. It's on its way, and I think it comes from the UK (which would be good), but BREXIT throws some sand into the delivery gears.
If the proofing copy is ok, I'll set up an alternative version with Standart color. Then I'll have to order a new proofing copy before I can put the Standart color POD on sale. 
Welp, I'll send out the codes ASAP after getting my copy, hoping that everything is in order with it. I'll also update you ASAP if there's new information. People are naturally unhappy about the change (which isn't DTRPG's fault but their partner's) so maybe something will change again.

Hey everybody!
Two quick messages: 
I ordered my copy of the Vaults for proofing yesterday. Now, I play the waiting game. According to DTRPG, it'll arrive in 3-4 weeks. Yay?
My new Kickstarter is now live, have a look: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1022698010/galgenbeck-after-dark

Hey everybody!
After putting in some additional work, I have finally uploaded the POD files to DTRPG. According to the website, it'll now take about 3 weeks until they send me a copy for proofing (assuming the files survive a manual check). I hope everything will be in order on the first try.
In the end, I decided to go with my initial plan of a letter-size magazine format. For one, it'd have been a nightmare to size it down it turns out, which would have broken all tables and more. And secondly, after some soul-searching, I came to the conclusion that I wanted to include the dungeon tiles at full letter-size after all.  I want to avoid selling a printed product that is missing a critical part, namely the tiles, which would only be available as an add-on file. Basically, I want to guarantee that people can still play it in 100 years after the internet is gone :)

Hello everybody! Two things:
Release
It's out baby! If everything went according to plan, and it seems it did, you should all have received a link via e-mail with which you can claim the Vaults of Torment on DTRPG. I just released it on itch.io as well, but I don't see a way to give away free copies with itch.io as of yet. There might be some people who want it in their itch library as well, so I'll look into it some more. So, if you haven't received a code from DTRPG, please let me know in the comments here.

Hey everybody! If everything goes according to plan, I'll send the draft of the Vaults to my editor on Monday the 19th of April. John (editor) and I go way back, so we're a good team and I guestimate that I'll manage a release around the end of April.
After the PDF release, I'll give it a few days or weeks for everybody to have a look at the finished product before I go full POD mode. From my experience, there are always few very minor errors that survive editing, and maybe someone reports back after discovering something :) So my current best guess for when the POD will be available is around the end of June? At least one proofing print has to cross the Atlantic or the Channel, who knows how long that'll take. I'll keep you posted and update how things develop.

ALL STRETCH GOALS UNLOCKED!
Including additional abominable monsters, unfathomable rituals, three adventures full of random tables, and a print on demand discount (at cost printing) for all backers!
Savage creatures lurk in the depths of forgotten crypts, incomprehensible relics lie waiting in the shadows of crumbling tombs, mystics argue incessantly trying to find a escape to the impending doom, and the powerful occupy themselves with vengeance through dark rituals, crushing the lives of those beneath them.
Despite it all, groups of rogues and raiders find their way through this hellish landscape; risking their lives for silver, glory, or hoping to find a way to escape the inevitable end when the 7:7 Misery strikes.
Welcome to MÖRK BORG, an RPG best described as: "A doom metal album of a game. A spiked flail to the face. Light on rules, heavy everything else". Winner of four Ennies: best writing (gold), best layout and design (gold), product of the year (gold), and best game (silver).
This eclectic zine is a 3th party production showing a few glimpses of the world of MÖRK BORG to drop into your game. The blasphemous tome will contain more than 30 pages of disturbing content in A5 format (45+ pages now that all stretch goals are unlocked), with more flavour than fluff and plenty of tables. Use them as the written word of prophets, or hack them into pieces for inspiration. Your game, your horrors.
Gaze upon the perils of a dying world and unleash unfathomable monsters, dubious allies, forgotten rituals and cursed relics on doomed characters treading the rotten earth under their tired feet. 
Glimpses of a Dying World will include, as a minimum:
A cruel and cowardly Flock of Fury 
A horrendous and corrupted Growth 
A humble essay on the folklore of Giants 
A miserable and forgotten Crypt Wanderer 
A despicable and unwelcoming Hermit 
The hellish ritual Mind Prison 
A desperate and dangerous Coven of Seers 
The lost knowledge of Daemonic Rituals 
Lowly Minions abused by greater powers
A clumsy and grotesque Six-Headed Eoten 
A vengeful Servant of the Drowned God 
An alchemically mutated Monstrosity 
A cursed Skull of the Damned 
A menagerie of Accursed Relics 
The heretical Sorcery of Blood 
A savage and astute Night Stalker 
The Circle of Sequestered Mystics 
Rules for the Carnage that comes from mass combat
Plus the unlocked content (names may change):
A cursed Weapon Generator 
A Galvanic Abyssal Octopus 
A Primordial Wyvern Spawn 
The Forsaken God (adventure, see preview below)
The Pit of Voloth the Rotten (adventure, see preview below)
A third adventure/dungeon crawl (details to be decided)
A burrower Worm Drake 
Two abominable rituals of Alchemy of the Flesh 
The Forsaken God - Destroy the abhorrent cult of the dreaming serpent and plunder the treasures left by the lifeless corpses of its followers.
The Pit of Voloth the Rotten - Stop the deranged alchemist of flesh and his vile crimes. Beware of the flaming pigs!
If the stars are right and this ritual is successful, we have planned the following stretch goals for all to enjoy as additional content in the zine: 
 🗹 A powerful, but possibly cursed, weapon generator! - £200 
 🗹 An adventure to infiltrate into the depths of a forgotten cult: "The Forsaken God" (an updated and improved version of my previously published adventure) - £400 
 🗹 A dungeon crawl into the laboratory of a derange alchemist! - £666 
 🗹 More glimpses of a dying world, such as the Primordial Wyvern Spawn or the Galvanic Abyssal Octopus! - £800 
 🗹 I will make the zine available as print on demand at cost to all backers! - £1000 
 🗹 A third adventure/dungeon crawl! - No £ threshold, just an appreciation gift back to the community
 ALL STRETCH GOALS UNLOCKED!
My name is Adrian, and I have been playing RPGs for a very long time. I enjoy all kinds on genres, but specially those with horrible and incomprehensible stuff in it. You can check on DriveThruRPG a couple of things I did before this zine: a collection of Perilous Encounters for D&D 5e, and Tales of High Adventure, a ruleset to play Forbidden Lands Sword & Sorcery style (including a very fitting adventure).
Feel free to message me on Kickstarter or Twitter (@adrianlsanjuan) if you have any questions about this project or just want to chat.

campaign.story:
Strange creatures are roaming the land! You have seen plenty, but those things are something else entirely. The chimeric amalgams and abominable hybrids from origins unknown are wreaking havoc and terrorizing the area. No end in sight to their squalid reign.

BEstitchARY is a bestiary zine slash supplement for MÖRK BORG role-playing game, which lets you generate creatures by... stitching them together.  

Who's that Mörkëmon? Oh... ewww...
This zine is an entry for the annual ZineQuest event by Kickstarter with a stipulation that only one color can be used (technically two: foreground and background). I took the challenge and as a result we all have to deal with Painfully Purple & Needlessly Neon. Good news is that a printer friendly version (Blightfully Black & Woefully White) will be part of each reward as well!
Colors begone!

This 15+ pages long A5 PDF zine contains:
D20 reasons for strange creatures to appear
40 unique creature parts (fronts and backs) allowing for 400 permutations!
Two simple ways to generate the creatures
Some additional optional rules to spice things up
An empty template to create creature parts of your own
All the creature parts include:
An illustration that seamlessly fits other parts
Part of the name
MÖRK BORG compatible stats: HP, morale, weapons, and armor 
A unique special ability
Size of the creature and the sounds it makes
Some creatures carry loot or have valuable hunting trophies
Price for a captured specimen
I didn't check all the 400 permutations yet and literally found this 1h before launching this KS.

Is it ready yet? 
All the text is ready and so are the graphics. Layout is mostly there but I'm the type of person that will spend hours moving things a few pixels here and there, until it clicks. My main focus for the duration of this campaign will be proofreading. I'm giving myself time until March, just to be safe, but I'm pretty sure you will see the PDFs earlier than that.  
PDF title page and page mockups.

Yes! Hellish as the creatures might seem, they can be encountered in many a world and realm, dying or not. You can generate them for any game and adjust the statistics to fit your setting or e.g. use the cards to only randomly generate the special abilities and slap them on any other existing creature.

What is this MÖRK BORG thing again?
Boy, are you in for a treat!
While you might have heard about it being described as "Artpunk" and "Metal", what MÖRK BORG really is, is an example of a simple yet beautiful and clever RPG design - both from a graphical and mechanical standpoint. It shows that you can break the mold and make your own rules. Then break your own damn rules too, why not.  It's evocative, inspiring, super inclusive and has the best community out there. 
Do check it out, it's worth all your silver.

They will also hunt me down if I don't say that Bestitchary is an independent production by Michał Gotkowski and is not affiliated with Ockult Örtmästare Games or Stockholm Kartell. It is published under the MÖRK BORG Third Party License. 
MÖRK BORG is copyright Ockult Örtmästare Games and Stockholm Kartell.


Seeing that this is my first kickstarter campaign and you most likely don't know me - you probably shouldn't! Cautious optimism is a correct reaction but maybe we can change that:
Who am I?
I'm Michał Gotkowski - a Warsaw-based TTRPG player, independent designer, and content creator. I have been creating RPG adjacent stuff for as long as I can remember but only recently gathered the courage to start releasing things to the public (thanks to the MÖRK BORG community!).
My released work
On my itch page you can check everything I have released recently (currently only for  MÖRK BORG but there's so much more in the pipeline). It's all free or "pay what you want" so you can easily verify if you like my style or not. 

Other than that, I have also tried my luck with neony and cyberpunky photography inspired by Liam Wong. Let me tell you, Warsaw is not Tokio, but there's a lot of beauty to be found here as well! Check my stuff on @needlesslyneon and @bleakandwhit.
Scope of this project
As much as I'd love to see this thing in print, I decided to only release it as PDF, to avoid adding extra complexity and to ensure that I can finish and deliver everything on time. No stretch goals either. Just a straightforward PDF zine full of beasts unheard of.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Unless the world literally collapses tomorrow, this project should not be at risk of any delays. To ensure that your patience and trust are not impared I have given myself time until March to deliver the PDFs, just to be extra sure.

campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
This has been designed with custom content and future extensions in mind - regardless if they come from me or anyone else!
Reusability and recyclability
Just with 40 creature parts you have 400 permutations of deadly monsters to deal with. Each creature part you create using the teamplate adds 20+ new permutations. The "fun" never ends!
Environmentally friendly factories
Only you are in control of how many and which pages to print. This comes with a hidden benefit of being able to print the same creature part more than once, ensuring that it is encountered more often. Now you have 10 shark tails AND you're helping the environment!

updates.update_userinfo: 901 friends would like to say: "Thank you!"
updates.update_content:
Just kidding. There's only one friend who is very thankful and 900 beasts that are simply hungry. 
To keep things short here's where I am with the project:
Core zine content is 100% finished
The extended backer content is 85% finished (should take two to three days)
Once the above is done it should take me maybe an additional day to update The Stitcherer

I was testing the printer friendly version of BEstitchARY the other day and while I love the DYI aspect and the freedom to use those elements however you choose, something occured to me. We all live in apocalyptic times now and it might take a while before we can meet in person again, print some weird creatures, and have some good o' hacking and slashing. Many of us have no other option than to play online and I wanted to address that as well, so I came up with...

We're 250 souls strong, which is not something I have even dreamt of... and let me tell you that I have the wildest dreams. With this many of us, there might be even a slim chance that we can put up a fight against all 400 of those ghastly beasts, but I anticipate that we will need more...

Before the reinforcements come though, it is time for some refreshments - for those interested, I have brewed up a a simple, intuitive, and system-agnostic alchemy ruleset yesterday, which is up for the grabs for free on my Itch page (will also appear on DriveThru RPG as soon as it gets approved).

campaign.story:
At Graven-Tosk the soil shall grow warm and those who rest be made to walk
The prophecy came true, now it's time to run. Grave Matters is a 30+ pages digital booklet full of new material for your Mörk Borg games, all with a common skeletal theme.  Grave Matters is not a stand-alone game and a copy of Mörk Borg is required to use it. 
 Surprise your players with:
 Pet Cemetery - new animal companions to wander the dying world with. You won't have to worry about their safety either, they're already dead.
 Alternative Weapons - why should you settle down for a femur?
 3 New Classes - Rotten Necromancer, Guilt Bearer and Death Hunter are ready to fight the undead horde... or join their ranks.
 10+ New Monsters - from snooty Skeletal Duelists to Putrefied Dragons every single monster is unique in its behaviors. Some may even be willing to join your cause.
And many New Uses for Dry Corpses, including new spells, weird encounters and morale rules for your playing characters.
 What about a physical printed version? The success of the campaign will define the size of this booklet and the possibility of a future printed version of it. See below. 
Bleached bones hoarded on the blackened earth, babbling endlessly. They will always tell you an important truth between a thousand lies. Recognizing it won't be easy, just like it won't be easy to shut them up.
Rummaging through crypts is really fun and you can never tell what kind of trinkets you'll find. This stretch goal will unlock a new set of abilities for all your characters. But beware: everything comes with a price, and it's usually a hidden one. 
 A new adventure will be added to the booklet. A village of living dead is having problems with a living creature. Playing Characters will be entrusted to take care of the terrifying marrow eater. 
The end is near and SHE hungers for more! If this stretch goal is reached the PDF of Grave Matters will be uploaded on itch.io FREE FOR EVERYONE since October 2021. Pledgers for the pdf will still get it in early May before anyone else. If this stretch goal is reached I will also try my best to make a printed version of this booklet through DrivethruRPG print on demand service, possibly giving all Tombstone pledgers a hefty discount for their copies.

Copyright stuff
Grave Matters is an independent production by Rinaldo Agostini and is not affiliated with Ockult Örtmästare Games or Stockholm Kartell. It is published under the MÖRK BORG Third Party License.
MÖRK BORG is copyright Ockult Örtmästare Games and Stockholm Kartell.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The general layout of the booklet is already done with most rules jolted down. The physical version of Grave Matters won't be part of this kickstarter but its existence will depend on the amount of interest this project will get. Sadly international shipping is really messy and the current crisis only aggravated the situation so nothing is certain about it. DrivethruRPG POD service will probably be the best solution to make it happen.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Happy New Year Samurai!
We wish you all the best for 2021, much happiness, success and most important of all: good health!
Reviews and Feedback

Well, as you probably notice by the comment activity on the main page, almost all of the orders have been sent out, and people are loving the game so far! We could not be more happy, thank you all!!
Status of orders containing Small Star Empires items
