updates.update_content:
Ok, as of this writing the next batch of content is out. It is over 150 pages of new content and puts us very close at content complete. We still have a few classes to finish, the Warren's Grove quest, and a few other odds and ends to add in. That will all likely be in Test Wave 3, as well as Test Wave 3 squashing more bugs you all have found (and will likely find in the new content too).
What this also means is we're at a great spot to finally start getting the backer content into the game! We wanted to have most of the game completed before we started adding that stuff in to avoid potential future conflicts in mechanics and themes. I will be gradually contacting all of you over the next few weeks. This process may take a bit because I want to make sure everyone gets exactly what they want. I'm starting at the spells and moving up from there. Please take a bit to look over the new content to ensure you get cool stuff in there without doubling up on something that already exists. Those that had an NPC, I'll spend some time getting to understand your character because they will likely end up in the final castle of Warren's Grove.

Hey everyone. I really don't have much more to share beyond the last update. I've been working my best to finish up what we promised and am about halfway through finishing the Black Castle (the final dungeon on the Warren's Grove adventure). It's a mighty big dungeon and, like everything on this project, has taken longer than expected. We also have all of the physical rewards for the nostalgia blaster finally in, though I'll give another update when we're ready to ship it all out. The timeliness I've given before have been unreliable (and that's me putting it nicely) so I want to have everything 100% complete before I make any more promises. 

By this point you would not be blamed for thinking we will never finish this. I can only apologize so much before it becomes stale. I hate that everything has turned out in, quite possibly, the worst way it could. We started very strong, and have done cool stuff, but the immensity of this project and my own personal life crushed me. All that being said, I am proud of what we have made so far. It's not finished, not by a bit, but it's dang cool and it's a lot of dang cool. All I can really tell you is that I've done my best, we will finish it, and that it hasn't been abandoned. I'm sorry its not done and I don't know when it will be but it will be and it will be something we can all be proud of then.

Hey everyone. 
I know there has been some (incredibly valid) frustration at out lack of updates and the length of time this project. I've not wanted to update until we had something finished that you could get your hands on (which is why the last update was around the Halloween stuff). We're still working on all of this. The final chapter of Warren's Grove has been the main focus for a bit but we just finished work on the Datamancer. That class took a while to get to something that will actually be fun to play and is going to require lots of breaking. We've also been shoring up the content that's already been released to (hopefully deliver a less broken version of) everything in Test Wave 3. None of this is nice and flashy yet and is taking a long time on my part, which is why there has been a lack of updates. I'm very sorry about that, I just hate having nothing exciting to show as the bar for our content is (in my opinion at least) pretty high. Updates like this can be just as frustrating as having no update (again, in my opinion). All that being said, we're very close to being done with everything (we've already hit the number of things we said and then some on most of the content already released) that is going into Test Wave 3, and then it's just a matter of putting it in our new format and splitting it into its separate books, instead of the massive tome it has been. All that's really missing from the core content is finishing the Warren's Grove questline (Black Castle) and adding more backer content. For those with characters and monsters, the final chapter of this quest is where all that is going, which is why it has taken so long to get to you on that.

Hey there everyone!
We really hope you've enjoyed digging into Test Wave 2.5 and have fun playing (and breaking) all the new stuff. Off the top, each of you should have received links in your associated emails for both a halloween supplement (Spooky Synthfire Stories) and Exoto-park Escape (apologies for that delay, I just wasn't happy with it yet). If you don't see it within 48 hours, leave a comment and I'll make sure it gets to you.

Hey everyone!
I’m really bad at updating regularly. I know. It’s something I struggle against but often fail at. I wish I could tell you that I will get better, but we all know that’s not likely at this point. To get more frequent updates please just follow Lluis or myself on twitter. So, let’s get the big stuff out of the way!
Yes, we are still here.

Hey everyone. Just a quick update to let you know we are still alive, still working, and, unfortunately, still behind. The bad news is that it’s taking longer to get the work done than we had hoped. The more personal details of the delays are on twitter (as we’d rather not clog up this space with that) but we have in no way stopped. Our plan was to be just about done with Test Wave 3 by now but it’s just not there yet. We could crank out some half-baked content and whip it to you but that’s not the kind of quality you expect. Anyway, we apologize and are going to just keep on moving forward and appreciate your patience.

Yes, hello! Sorry about the wait and silence. Right about the time our Kickstarter was wrapping up some personal life issues came into play for the team. There was some rough emotional turmoil that had to be sorted through and it came at the worst possible time. We’re sorry about that, and the silence it resulted in, but that is life sometimes! As much as we like making this project, it is a labor of love and the well being of our families comes first. That being said, we’re going to try and be more consistent about updates. You can always follow us on twitter (Chris, Design) (Lluis, Art) for smaller but more frequent updates.

Just a quick update everyone. The Second Test Wave file has been sent to all backers of the Tester tier and higher! Please check your Spam or Promotion folders (for the e-mail address you use on Kickstarter) and if you have any problems, please let me know so we can try and fix them. BackerKit Surveys will be going out very soon. They start in small batches so you may see your friends getting them before you, don't worry, that's normal. Additional content, like the Nachoverse and Paper Minis will be going out shortly after they are finished; there's nothing you need to do on your end for that, just check you e-mail every so often.

I’ve spent the last 2 days just trying to wrap my head around this whole thing. It swelled beyond what I even though possible and you all have taken this to the next level. Now it’s our turn to step up to the plate and really knock this out of the park! We’re going to dive back in pretty much immediately and start cranking on all this new content! 
Test Wave 2 will be coming to backers very soon! We’re waiting for funds and such to process through Kickstarter so shoot for 7 to 14 days from now. Please make sure your payment methods are up to date to ensure this goes as smoothly as possible! As of now there are only a few pending errors with charges and we have sent messages notifying those affected.

campaign.story:
At Calliope Games, we are thrilled to celebrate our 10 Year Anniversary!  Over the past decade, our library of gateway and filler games have entertained, inspired, and provided an opportunity to make memories around the game table, and it all started with our flagship title, Tsuro: The Game of the Path.  We couldn’t think of a better way to celebrate this 10 year milestone than by returning to the series that started it all - so we welcome you to the launch of a brand new Tsuro game!
Long ago, a vengeful god stole the stars from the night sky. To illuminate the night, brave people released glowing paper lanterns toward the heavens. This act of hope summoned clever magical phoenixes, who soared through the sky and raced toward the lanterns. 
As the birds flew from lantern to lantern, their enchanted touch transformed the lanterns into brilliant new stars! Before the people's very eyes, the night sky became illuminated with beauty, all because of the firebirds.  The phoenix that creates a constellation of seven new stars will illuminate the night sky and once again restore balance to Tsuro...the path of life! 
In Tsuro: Phoenix Rising, an exhilarating new entry in the classic Tsuro series, each player is a phoenix, soaring across the board in an effort to reach glowing lanterns and transform them into new stars in the night sky.  The first player to collect seven star tokens wins the game!
Tsuro: Phoenix Rising builds upon the foundation of classic Tsuro – you must play tiles to extend your path, traverse the board, and be aware of your surroundings – but it adds exciting new features such as double-sided path tiles that allow for diagonal movement and can be flipped and rotated to choose your destination, as well as a revolutionary new molded board.  As a phoenix, you also have the astounding ability to rise from the ashes and return to the board once per game! 
All New Gameplay! – Become a phoenix!  Soar across the board, flipping and rotating the double-sided tiles to build your path on the revolutionary new modular board.
New Twist on classic Tsuro – Builds upon the foundation of Tsuro – create your path, stay on the board – but introduces exciting new elements such as set collection, strategic board manipulation…and the ability to rise from your ashes and return!
Exclusive Kickstarter Content! – Pledge now so you don’t miss out!  Kickstarter set comes with these exclusive items you won't find in stores later*:  
* Exclusive content layout and visuals will vary from those pictured on this page.  Exclusive items may be sold by Calliope Games at conventions or online but will not be available through standard distribution.
Every copy of the game comes with:
4 innovative game trays, which connect to form the game board
36 double-sided Path tiles 
1 Phoenix tile 
1 translucent acrylic First Player marker
8 Phoenix miniatures 
8 glass bead "ash" Life tokens 
7 "glowing" translucent Lantern markers: 3 Red, 2 Blue, and 2 Yellow
50 golden Star tokens
1 Rulebook
The Kickstarter Exclusive Set also features these upgrades and additional materials which will not be available as add-ons later:
And every copy of the game will come with these unlocked stretch goals:
Here's a closer look at some of the premium components included in every copy of the game:
Eight beautifully sculpted Phoenix miniatures
Seven "glowing" translucent Lantern markers in three shapes.
The unique patented tray allows one tile to be flipped and rotated without disturbing the others.
*Note that the final appearance of all components and upgrades may change. 
Tsuro: Phoenix Rising is built on the foundation of the classic game Tsuro: The Game of the Path by Tom McMurchie.  Some core gameplay elements remain, such as placing tiles and moving your pawn along the path.  However, as a Phoenix, your turns in the game will now consist of extending your path, moving your Phoenix pawn, transforming Lanterns into Stars, and scoring Stars to make a constellation!
For additional copies of the standard retail edition of Tsuro: Phoenix Rising, manually add $40 per game to your pledge.  There is no extra shipping for one additional copy.  To receive 3-6 copies of the game, manually add double the shipping cost. 
Pledge $20 now to be a part of the Tsuro: Phoenix Rising retailer program and receive your full margin plus 4 additional points for your support.  You may choose the Standard Retail Edition or Kickstarter Exclusive Set.  You will also have an opportunity to fill out your order with other Calliope titles at the same margin; FFA $350 (destination USA - See FAQ for details).  Retailer orders will be shipped with all other Kickstarter orders prior to standard distribution. Your final order and payment will not be finalized until the game is ready to ship.  Orders must be placed in case quantities (6 units per case); maximum two cases per location. 
Physical store verification will be required; you must provide the store name, store address, phone number, EIN number, and website or Facebook page. If you choose this option and we determine you are not a brick-and-mortar retailer, you will be charged the difference in price for one standard retail edition of Tsuro: Phoenix Rising after the campaign. No refunds will be issued. Result of the verification process by Calliope Games will be final.  
NOTE: International retailer copies will be shipped at the same time as all international backer copies; international freight forwarding may cause delays in fulfillment.  
The truth is, we packed all possible quality and value in the presentation of Tsuro: Phoenix Rising.  Upgraded tile thickness?  Done.  Fancy components?  Included.  Amazing tray?  You got it!!  So we can't approach stretch goals the same way other campaigns might.
Instead, we are going to treat stretch goals as a bonus for backers, to celebrate the entire Tsuro series!
Everyone at the Standard Retail Edition, Kickstarter Exclusive Set, Legacy of Tsuro, or Way of the Retailer pledge levels will receive all unlocked stretch goals when Tsuro: Phoenix Rising is fulfilled!  No additional charge or shipping will be required!  
A note about grouping multiple copies of Tsuro: Phoenix Rising:
Each copy of Tsuro: Phoenix Rising at the Standard Retail Edition, Kickstarter Exclusive Set, Legacy of Tsuro, or Way of the Retailer levels will come with one of each stretch goal item, so you can put together a group pledge and every copy will come with the goodies!  This also means retailers will be able to provide the stretch goal items for all copies!
We are offering subsidized shipping costs in order to strike the best balance of value for our backers and actual cost to us. We have strategically partnered with trusted fulfillment partners around the world experienced in shipping Kickstarter rewards.
*See Update #2 for list of EU Neighbor countries. 
The above costs reflect the Standard Retail Edition and Kickstarter Exclusive Set pledge levels; Way of the Retailer and Legacy of Tsuro levels may be slightly higher due to quantity of boxes to be shipped.  Shipping costs will be charged after the campaign ends through CrowdOx. 
10 years ago, Calliope Games began as a collaboration between Dawne Weisman, Jordan Weisman, and Ray Wehrs. All of us are experienced game industry professionals who have worked together since 1999 when we collectively launched WizKids. Calliope Games has been producing and selling quality tabletop games since 2009. Our products are inspired by family for families. To date we have released 19 titles, many of which were brought to life here on Kickstarter!
At Calliope Games, we publish fun, affordable, family-style tabletop games for all to enjoy.  
With gamers in mind, our games make the perfect "gateway" or "filler" game. They allow you to easily draft your non-gamer friends into your favorite hobby. Calliope games are excellent for starting out game night and are easily played between heavier games. It’s important to point out to our non-gamer friends that we do take a slightly different approach to the games we produce. At Calliope, we focus on entertaining adults; however, the games we produce allow children to compete with their parents without the parents “throwing” the game. It’s a really a pretty simple concept; instead of having the parents step down into the child’s world, we are inviting the child to step up into the parents' world.  
For gamers and non-gamers alike, the results of our efforts are games that are accessible by all players regardless of skill level or age, play in under 60 minutes, are affordably priced, and most of all… are a blast to play!
If you would like to add other amazing games from our catalog to your pledge, you may do so by manually adjusting your pledge using the amounts below.  The appropriate shipping will be collected post-campaign when the survey is sent.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With any venture, there are risks... those that are seen, and those that are unseen. The biggest foreseeable risks we currently face are manufacturing in China and shipping issues from China to our warehouse here in the US.

Each of these risks is greatly minimized with Calliope Games. Our factories have been with us for many years. They know how we work and the quality we expect. In addition, our freight forwarder and fulfillment teams are world class and have over 30 years of expertise to rely upon. If any issues arise, we will know of them far in advance and will be able to overcome them.

Upcoming tariffs may influence costs as well. Typically these are 10%-25% of our total manufacturing cost. Should tariffs affect prices, these will be reflected in the post-campaign shipping and fulfillment cost.

As far as the unseen risks... we know they are there and we have built a safety margin into our costs of goods sold to prepare us for the unforeseen. To date we've launched 19 games under the Calliope brand, many with a good number of reprints, and we have overcome all major production issues in providing our players quality entertainment experiences.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hello Phoenix Fans!
From all of us at Calliope Games, we hope you are staying safe and well during these challenging times.  We try to find ways to stay happy, and luckily board games have that power!  We hope you have enjoyed Tsuro: Phoenix Rising!
Replacement Tiles
During the manufacturing process of Tsuro: Phoenix Rising, the factory we were using produced tiles with lower-than-expected quality in a small percentage of the copies.  These tiles had issues with peeling along the edges, and were not to our standards.

updates.update_userinfo: Spring 2020 Update - Call For Missing Orders
updates.update_content:
Hello Phoenix Fans!
The campaign for Tsuro: Phoenix Rising is long over and fulfillment is over 99% complete. We have shipped out well over 3,500 orders all over the world, with only around 100 orders outstanding.  More on that in a moment.
This update will talk about the state of things in the world, introduce an amazing friend, touch on replacement parts, and provide steps for backers who haven't received their copies of the game.
Our World Today

Hi all!
Just a quick note to let you know how fulfillment is proceeding.  Thanks to everyone for your patience as we get these games out to you!
Fulfillment Status

Hi everyone! Hope your Halloween wasn't too spooky!
We wanted to end the week with a global fulfillment status update.  Domestic fulfillment is underway, and international fulfillment is due to begin starting next week.  Let's get into specifics:
U.S.

Hello, everyone! Our team is out of town at the Tacoma Holiday Food and Gift Festival, which a wonderful show! We are having a great time and playing games with lots of people, but it keeps us busy busy busy!
Tsuro: Phoenix Rising has begun shipping to domestic backers from our warehouse. This is exciting! Please be aware that this is a BIG job for them and will take some time to complete. We will be back soon with an update about the progress and expected timeline, but don’t panic if you don’t see your shipping notification email right away. Please be patient and soon you’ll be playing!

updates.update_userinfo: Tsuro: Phoenix Rising is soaring...er, SAILING our way!
updates.update_content:
Hi all,
Happy Autumn! The leaves are turning red and orange and yellow, all the colors of the magical phoenix!  With that in mind, we are happy to report that Tsuro: Phoenix Rising is currently making its voyage to our fulfillment partners around the world.  In other words, it's on the boat!

Hello Phoenix Phans!!
Chris here!  First, I apologize for not sending this update right after Gen Con.  It was an incredibly busy and exciting show - and perhaps a touch more hectic than ever before when our fearless president Ray was given doctor's orders to stay home to get over an illness ONE DAY before he was to leave for the trip!  When we got home, we took a couple days to recuperate and then threw ourselves back into the business of making games!  This update was on my list, and I just plain forgot!  So let's get to it and see what's going on!
GEN CON WRAP UP

campaign.story:
Suburbia is a tile-laying, city-building game from Ted Alspach, originally published in 2012. Suburbia has won numerous awards, is highly rated on Boardgamegeek.com, and is widely considered the best city-building boardgame of all time.
Suburbia Collector's Edition has been totally reworked from the ground up, with all new art, components, and additions. The fresh look of the design brings new life and amazing detail to your cities. The game features four sets of custom-designed Game Trayz™ with lids for organizing and displaying components. In addition, it includes all existing expansions and promo tiles and even a brand new expansion: Nightlife. 
There are plenty of Kickstarter exclusives: metal coins, a lighted start player marker, wooden interactivity markers, a themed tile set guide, and the ability to choose which 5 player colors (and as a result, which special city tiles and unique borough boards) you want to make your game one-of-a-kind. You'll also save $30 off of the retail version which doesn't have any Kickstarter exclusives.




This project is promoted by Green Inbox

campaign.story:
Hey, I’m Sky!
I've felt lost and alone many times in my life, & I'm creating this album because I want you to know that you never are. I've found strength and solace in others' work throughout my life, and it is my hope that this album provides a place of restful healing for you as well. 
I'm asking for your help funding the production of my debut album! It is the first of its kind, carving out a healing world, a new genre that combines video game hardware, acoustic instruments, and ethereal vocals. And a tour! With 3 cities already confirmed in North America, I look forward to meeting all you lovely humans. 
You may have heard my voice on tracks that I’ve done with friends in the EDM world.
What do you do?
I produce music under the name Azuria Sky. In the past few years I’ve written numerous songs and performed them at multiple shows around the country. If you’re familiar with the chipmusic scene, you’ll know that this was my home, where I have spent most of my time growing.
Pulsewave / Babycastles - New York, NY (@lippemfg)
Photo: @lippemfg
Babycastles - New York, NY
Wayward Social - Brooklyn, NY (@lippemfg)
I use old video game hardware in conjunction with acoustic guitar and piano to create this very raw fabric of sound to sing over. I first experimented with this combination in the song Listen_, the opening track of my album Gravity, which I released in 2015.
This new album is a conscious exploration of that sound -- it’s an auditory portrait of emotions I have seen and felt over the past 3 years. It’s very personal. I think the music that I write is the most intimate way I can express what I’ve been through, and the only way I know how to connect with and uplift others. 
Three years and 3,000 miles later, I have arrived in Los Angeles, ready to start a new chapter. 
Thank you for supporting my work. I hope it brings you as much solace and healing as it has for me. 
Pulsewave / Babycastles - New York, NY (@lippemfg)
What is the difference between composition and production?
Composition is the process of birthing the song -- it is when I figure out what note goes where, what sound goes beep and what sound goes TWANG. I try to get these ideas down as quickly as possible, so many of these drafts are full of background noise and static, often recorded on my phone.
All the drafts are fully composed, and ready to for me to hunker down over to produce and package into delivery ready MP3s! The next phase is production.
Production is the part that requires meticulous attention, and can be quite arduous. This is when the audio cables and mixing board comes out. It’s the journey of sitting in front of the microphone and playing dozens of takes until you find the perfect phrasing and timbre. It's when the pop-filter rescues the microphone from condensation formed by me breathing on it for a billion hours. It’s the task of shaping sounds, making sure each instrument and each detail is delivered with the utmost clarity. Production is the process that brings the ideas and notes to life, it’s where the magic enters the mix. 
Why do you need my help?
Commercial recording studio costs are prohibitively expensive. Most run anywhere from 300-500 USD per session.
Digital music production has progressed drastically over the past decade, and with dedication and time it is 100% possible to produce radio quality music in a home studio. 
I’m a one-person team. With an absurd amount of self-motivation, a hearty dose of confidence, and several years of experience under my belt, I need your help so that I can focus all my efforts over the next few months towards bringing this album to you.
So that leads to the question --
Why are you self-releasing?
BitxBit, Digital Arts Demo Space - Chicago, IL (@chiptography)
With an overarching project of this magnitude, it makes sense to navigate from the captain’s chair whenever possible. Relying on someone else to package and deliver your experience adds more moving parts to the equation. By self-releasing, I can guarantee both the quality and timeliness of what I deliver to you.
What's in the box?
We Were Once Called Spring is my debut album, in a representative sense. I am super proud to finally be able to say, “Hello world, this is me.”
So... hi. <3
This album includes:
10 original tracks!
Each track is a unique amalgam of acoustic instruments, 8-bit soundscapes, lo-fi ambiance, and heartfelt vocals. 
2 music videos!
The 2 singles off the album will each have a beautifully polished music video. My videographer and I will be traveling to film at a gorgeous, secret location for 3 days.
Stills from earlier film tests:
Location 1
Location 2
A chipmusic B-side! 
Old-school versions of all the songs (in the style of Pokemon, Zelda, etc.) authentically recorded on a Nintendo Gameboy.
Here's a sample track:
And here's the Gameboy (LSDJ) version:
20 tracks in total.
When is it coming out? 
The album will be released April 2019 on all major music platforms. 
(Spotify, Apple Music, iTunes, etc.)
There will be a Kickstarter exclusive livestream of the album in February.
As a Kickstarter, you will get an inside look at the creation process, as well as access to exclusive behind-the-scenes content and demos.
BitxBit, Digital Arts Demo Space - Chicago, IL (@chiptography)
What are the costs?
This album will be produced at the bare minimum of what is required -- I will not be profiting from this Kickstarter, and only ask for your support to be able to bring this project to completion.
All costs are transparent, and are listed here:
Expense breakdown
Once the project is funded, there will be a public task list available for viewing, so you can follow along every step of the way. 
I'm ready to rev up the engines.
See you in October. <3
Photo: @chiptography

campaign.story:
Meet the Flip Grip, a handheld accessory for vertical-mode gaming on the Switch. A pair of Joy-con rails on either side of the grip allow you to flip the Switch 90 degrees for vertical handheld action. 
The Switch has become an amazing machine for playing classic games on-the-go. Classic titles are being re-released on the Switch at a rapid pace, with new ones coming out each week. 
Many Switch re-releases of classic titles, like those from Namco and SNK, include display options to rotate the game’s display 90º for games that appeared in arcade cabinets with vertical-mode screens.
On previous consoles, few people could make use of vertical-mode orientation features — it's hard to turn a television sideways, after all. A few PSP games supported rotation, but playing an intense arcade shooter while you grip the top and bottom of the PSP was far from a great experience. 
The Switch changes everything. Because you can remove the Joy-Cons from the system, we can finally play classics like Punch-Out!!, Galaga, and Strikers 1945-II properly in vertical mode.
However, Nintendo never designed the Switch to be used in portable vertical mode. The system's Joy-Con rails only allow you to hold the Switch in horizontal mode.
Until now, using the Switch in vertical mode required propping up the console sideways on a stand to use as a tabletop system. That's better than nothing, but it doesn't get to the heart of what Switch is all about: portability.
The Flip Grip makes portable vertical-mode gaming possible. Simply slide the Switch into the Flip Grip, then attach Joy-Cons, and voila — a handheld system capable of playing vertical-mode games without wasting a single pixel of real estate. 
With publishers like SNK and Capcom releasing new classic titles for the Switch, the number of games available to play in vertical mode will only grow. And not just classic games — modern releases like Ikaruga include vertical-mode support, too. 
And the Flip Grip is the key to being able to enjoy these releases on-the-go.
Note that this is a 3D printed prototype and is not representative of the final product.
The Flip Grip consists of a single piece of durable injection-molded plastic designed to hold the Switch rotated 90 degrees counterclockwise. Slide the Switch in until it clicks into place, then slide the Joy-Cons into the rails on either side just like you would on the console. 
The rails on the Flip Grip are designed to emulate the same rails you find on the Switch itself, so installation and removal of Joy-Cons is easy and familiar.  
The Flip Grip has been designed to accept the Switch in only one direction (90 degrees counterclockwise). This orientation exposes the game card and SD card slots, as well as the headphone jack.  
You don't need to worry about inserting the console the wrong way — the inner edge of the Flip Grip is specially molded to the shape of the Switch, and won't allow you to slide it in all the way in the wrong direction. 
The Flip Grip also has a rubber bump on the inside that holds your Switch securely in place to prevent the console from falling out during active play sessions.
To release the Flip Grip, press the release buttons on each Joy-Con and slide them up to remove them. 
Pull gently on the small release tab on the back side of the Flip Grip to unlock the Switch from the grip. 
The Flip Grip isn't just for handheld gaming! You can also use it as a stand, too. One of the slots on the back of the Flip Grip allows you to use any credit card to prop up the Switch for social play… or just give your tired arms a break.
The Flip Grip is brought to you courtesy of a game nerd power trio:
Jeremy Parish/Retronauts: This project got its start when Retronauts podcast co-host and former 1UP/IGN/USgamer editor Jeremy Parish realized Namco Museum on Switch supported vertical play, but that Switch itself didn't. After it became clear that no one intended to bridge that gap, he began exploring the possibility of making it happen himself. 
Mike Choi: As a hardware engineer, inventor, and avid video game player, Mike Choi took the Flip Grip concept from Jeremy’s napkin sketch into a real-deal accessory. Through months of prototyping and iterating, Mike has arrived at an elegant, durable, and inexpensive design for the Flip Grip, as well as the Flip Grip’s charming mascot, Flippy. 
Fangamer: The glue that holds this project together, Fangamer's years of experience managing ventures like this has made Flip Grip possible. They connected Jeremy and Mike, consistently rolled 20s for sanity checks, and have midwifed this campaign into existence. 
The hard work of designing and prototyping is complete, but manufacturing Flip Grip requires a commitment of thousands of dollars up-front, and it's important for us to be sure that an audience exists for such a niche product before sinking that much money into this beautiful dream of ours. 
As such, this will be a very straightforward Kickstarter campaign. Want a Flip Grip? That's what the campaign is here for!
This isn't about some impossible, pie-in-the-sky dream: Flip Grip is fully designed and ready to manufacture. We’ve got our vendors in place and they’re ready to go. We just need to raise the funds to cut the tools that will be used to mass produce Flip Grip. 
Fangamer has its own warehouse and distribution system, so the logistics of Flip Grip shipping are all in-hand. We’ve set a target date of November for shipping Flip Grip.
While Flip Grip production is locked in, there are still a few caveats we need to mention.
Vertical UI (or lack thereof)
First, Nintendo didn't design Switch for use in vertical mode. That means Flip Grip is awesome for actually playing games that offer a screen rotation feature, but everything outside those games is going to appear and operate sideways — you know, systems menus and eShop and the like. You'll probably only want to make use of Flip Grip during gameplay.
That said, many developers do incorporate a rotated system interface inside games that support vertical mode. It's case-by-case, but some games will offer a better experience than others.
Functionality with Flip Grip
The other concern is, well, Nintendo really didn't design Switch for use in vertical mode. A few critical features run along Switch's upper and lower edges, and the Flip Grip unavoidably obstructs some of them.
Flip Grip provides access to the headphone jack, SD Card slot, and Game Card slot. You can't access the physical power or volume buttons with the Flip Grip in place, but you can access volume, brightness and sleep options by long pressing the home button on the right Joy Con.
This is an inconvenience, no question about it — you need to slip the Switch out of the Flip Grip in order to power it off completely, or recharge its battery. Otherwise, you can still access most functionality by long pressing the home button and navigating the system menus, even when the Flip Grip is attached.
Venting and Thermal Concerns
One of the biggest questions we’ve seen about early teases of Flip Grip is around heat and venting issues. “Won’t the Flip Grip cause the Switch to overheat by covering the vents?”
Upon first glance, it may look like the Flip Grip covers some of the vents on the Switch. Although these vents are not visible when the Flip Grip is installed, air is still flowing through them. The Flip Grip doesn’t come anywhere close to creating an airtight seal around your console; there are slits and clearances that allow air to enter in and out of the necessary vents.
To prove this in practice, we’ve run extensive tests that show that there are no appreciable differences in temperature when the Flip Grip is installed, even when running intensive games like Breath of the Wild.
To put you even more at ease, the simple reality is that Nintendo designed Switch to use less power while in handheld mode… and less power usage means lower temperatures. Even high-impact games like Breath of the Wild don't generate enough heat during play to bring the system's internal temperature anywhere near its limits. The Switch only operates at full power when docked, and it's physically impossible to dock your system while using Flip Grip.
We've also shared the Flip Grip with quite a few developers and publishers, and none of them have expressed concern about this feature.
Maintaining airflow through the vents is something we’ve been very mindful of from our first prototype, and we feel obligated to tell you exactly what we’ve learned and let you draw your own conclusions. Although our extensive testing has made us confident the Flip Grip is completely safe to use, we take no responsibility in the unlikely event that your Switch is damaged or malfunctions while you’re using the Flip Grip.
Orientation Compatibility
Oh, and one other small concern: While Flip Grip works perfectly now with dozens of games, there are one or two titles that only support 90-degree rotation in the opposite direction of Flip Grip's orientation. D'oh! Hopefully Flip Grip will turn out to be such a huge success that those developers will patch in a reverse orientation option…
 The Flip Grip project is a work of genuine passion from people who love classic games, who love handheld games, and who love the Switch. We’re also excited to see how the Flip Grip enables developers to release new vertical-mode experiences for the Switch.  
We're not out to make a huge profit from this campaign — we simply want to make Flip Grip a reality and get it into as many people's hands as possible. There's never been a console better suited to putting perfect arcade recreations in your hands, and we want to play a part in bringing those experiences to you.
Thank you!
___
In order fulfill your backer rewards, personal data will be transferred from Kickstarter to Fangamer, both US companies, and used in accordance with Fangamer’s Privacy Policy.

campaign.story:
Welcome to Themeborne’s second Kickstarter campaign: The Legend Grows...
Whether you're a returning backer or just discovering Escape the Dark Castle for the first time - this new campaign is for you. 
If you already own a copy of the game you can skip ahead to the What's New? section, and don't forget to check the add-ons too.
Newcomers, a warm welcome to the community of Escape the Dark Castle players. Allow us to run you through the story so far...
Escape the Dark Castle is a simple, fantasy adventure game with a focus on atmosphere, storytelling and player cooperation – perfect for newcomers to tabletop gaming. It takes 2 minutes to set up, lasts around 30 minutes, and no two games are ever the same.      
Players take the roles of prisoners on a quest to Escape the Dark Castle, and must work together to overcome its many horrors, traps, and challenges - each of which is represented by a large, beautifully illustrated chapter card. 
As these immersive chapter cards are revealed one by one, the game takes on the form of a shared storybook experience, with the players making decisions about what to do each chapter before using a combination of dice and item cards to complete challenges. 
The goal of the game is to complete every chapter in the castle deck, then defeat the final boss. To win, you must keep every member of the team alive - if any player is killed the game ends immediately!
After our first campaign in 2017, we released Escape the Dark Castle along with the first expansion, Adventure Pack 1: Cult of the Death Knight. Now we're back with a selection of new expansions and add-ons to further expand and deepen your adventures. 
This game has simple rules so it’s easy to learn. You’ll be able to get started within 5 minutes. Click here for a quick overview, and you can read the full rules here. You can also watch one of the many gameplay videos in our Reviews section below. 
 READ:
                                              WATCH:
Beasts of War (full playthrough)
Paul Darcy (6 short play episodes)
For Chits & Giggles (full play & review)
Unfiltered Gamer (review)
User Gameplay (contains strong language)
   Beyond Solitaire (how to play solo)
Bestplay (review)
         LISTEN: 
     So far, the Escape the Dark Castle range includes the following (and both are available as add-ons when you back this campaign):
Escape the Dark Castle
Adventure Pack 1 - Cult of the Death Knight
This Kickstarter campaign is for three new expansions: 
Adventure Pack 2 - Scourge of the Undead Queen
Adventure Pack 3 - Blight of the Plague Lord
The Collector's Box
Gorging on the castle’s unending supply of tortured souls, the Undead Queen calls to her service the corpses, skeletons, and spirits of the depths. If a prisoner should fall at the hands of her inexhaustible armies, all that awaits is an eternity of agonising undeath…
Contains:  
1 New Boss: The Undead Queen, a foul necromancer bent on enslaving your soul
15 New Chapters: The Undead Queen’s terrifying forces, and new castle locations 
3 Companion Characters: Vital allies to accompany the prisoners and assist in their escape 
3 Companion Trigger Cards: Event cards which signify the arrival of a Companion
3 Companion Dice: Used to carry out Companion actions and special abilities
2 New Items: Each a powerful relic for the prisoners to discover 
1 New Item Dice: Used to apply the powers of a relic
New Mechanic
This Adventure Pack introduces a new mechanic to the system - Companions. These characters can appear during a quest and join-up with the prisoners to assist in their escape. Fans of roleplaying games will know them by the term NPCs (non-player characters). Players will now encounter event cards in the item deck which trigger the arrival of one of the Companions. Each Companion has a unique mixture of traits and a special ability. They are powerful allies but their presence may be fleeting, so prisoners must choose carefully how and when to call on them. 
In the most confined, twisting passageways; in the vaulted eaves of the highest towers; in the fetid air drawn sharply into your panicked lungs – there will you find his creation. For he is the Plague Lord, emanator of an all-encompassing evil. A monstrous mass of weeping pustules, it would be his most perverse pleasure to watch as you slowly succumb to the agonising torment of the Black Death...
Contains:  
1 New Boss: The Plague Lord, only growing stronger the more infected he becomes  
15 New Chapters: The Plague Lord’s deranged followers, and new castle locations  
3 New Characters: Versatile new prisoners ready to join the quest  
3 Character Dice: Representing the new prisoner’s endowment of skills  
5 New Items: Vital new equipment for prisoners to discover in the depths
1 Plague Dice: Used to control the contraction and spread of this vile disease
New Mechanic
This Adventure Pack introduces a new mechanic to the system - Plague. As if the horrors, traps, and challenges of the Dark Castle were not already enough to haunt the prisoner’s every waking thought, there is now a new kind of threat to contend with. As they explore the labyrinthine castle passages, players can now encounter Carriers, plague-infected lunatics bent on spreading the disease. Certain interactions with Carriers can cause prisoners to contract, spread, and even succumb entirely to this rampant atrocity, adding a new dimension and weight to the game’s risk-reward decisions.
An expansion in its own right, the Collector’s Box contains a wealth of new, fan-driven game content for Escape the Dark Castle while also providing stylish and practical storage for your entire collection.
(not final design, some items shown are sold seperately)
Contains:  
6 New Boss Cards: An array of powerful new foes, each with a unique and devious mechanic
12 Special Ability Cards: Unlock the prisoner's talents as they reach new heights of heroism
2 New Start Cards: Now you’ll never know exactly how your adventure will begin
2 Epilogue Cards: Whether you escape or not, get complete narrative closure to every quest
4 Health Trackers with Cubes: An optional alternative to the scorepad & pencil system
1 Dice Bag: Store all the game’s beautiful dice in one satisfying pouch
1 “First Player” Card: Used to help keep track of who is taking the lead each chapter
1 Icon Chart: A handy reference to help new players remember what everything means
(not final design, some items shown are sold seperately)
Storage for your entire collection, now and in the future
With it’s sturdy, matt black box and minimal spot UV detailing, the imposing exterior of the Collector’s Box hides an elegant organiser within. Now you can store every item in your Escape the Dark Castle collection in one box with ease.  
The custom insert lets you arrange your cards by set, type, or however you see fit, simply slipping them into the rows of card dividers – sleeved or unsleeved. Not only is this immensely satisfying, it also cuts down on card handling time during setup - just slide out the desired modules and your tailored game can be set up in moments. 
The larger cavity is molded to securely hold all your rulebooks, scorepads, pencils & cubes, with extra space set aside to store all the great products offered in this Kickstarter (see the Add-ons section further down the page). We’ve even included space for several more expansions, so future releases will fit right in.

To include add-ons in your pledge, simply increase your pledge amount by the total value of all the add-ons you want. At the end of the campaign you'll be given access to our pledge manager, Backerkit, which allows you to select exactly which items you want to put your pledged amount towards.

Escape the Dark Castle - £29.00
The reason we are all here. The standard edition of the main game in all its glory. For more details check out our original Kickstarter campaign. 
  Kickstarter Upgrade Kit - £5.00
With this kit we're giving everyone the chance to get Kickstarter exclusive content from the first campaign that didn't make it into the standard edition of Escape the Dark Castle.

Adventure Pack 1: Cult of the Death Knight - £14.00
Welcome prisoner, to a new era of The Dark Castle. The Death Knight himself, legendary swordsman and the one they call ‘Lord of Decay’, has risen to prominence. The weak and the mindless flock to his banner, twisted by his dark influence into powerful, feral fanatics. They say he sends curses to crawl into the souls of the weary. Beware the curses, prisoner. Beware the Death Knight…
Contains: 
1 Boss - The Death Knight himself
15 Chapter Cards - We won't spoil them for you
3 New Characters - Each especially powerful in one trait
3 Character Dice - Representing the skills of each new prisoner
5 Curse Cards - With devious effects to thwart your progress
1 Cult Dice - Pray you won't need to roll it...
Card Sleeves
Clear card sleeves specially produced to protect your Escape the Dark Castle collection.
There are sleeves for both sizes of Escape the Dark Castle cards: A6 (large) and A8 (small). One pack of each is enough to completely sleeve the main game (including the contents of the Kickstarter upgrade kit). To sleeve expansions, you'll need additional packs. 
A6 Clear Sleeves - £5.00
A8 Clear Sleeves - £3.00
Escape the Dark Castle Playmats - £5.00
Take your game to the next level of desirability with our beautifully illustrated neoprene playmats. Each mat serves one player, and is designed to allow different configurations of the game components. 

Escape the Dark Castle Playmats are designed to fit perfectly into the Collector's box.
Tales from the Dark - £10.00
Prepare to immerse yourself even further into the world of The Dark Castle with Tales from the Dark - more than 20 works of short fiction penned by published game-writer and co-designer of Escape the Dark Castle, Thomas Pike.


This is a new and improved version of the edition released as a PDF during the first campaign, including new stories covering the characters subsequently introduced.

Excerpt:
"The Abbot's assailants were mere shadows, beings of darkness with long, strong hands. He felt himself dragged deeper into the cave and stripped of his possessions. Another heavy blow landed. He faded from consciousness..."
This is a printed, perfect bound softback book, and includes a free PDF version.Tales from the Dark is designed to fit perfectly into the Collectors Box.
The Death Book - £8.00
Add a new narrative dimension to your games with The Death Book.
This crumbling old tomb contains a contextual 'death scene' for every chapter card in the game - at least, those which are capable of killing a prisoner, and of the bosses too.

No matter which chapter card finishes you off, you'll be able to flip to the corresponding section of The Death Book and read out all the gory details of your demise. What better way to end a game of Escape the Dark Castle?


Excerpt:
"You fall to the ground exhausted and delirious. There was no heroic battle, no valiant climax - just too much strain on a body and mind not fit to bear it. Eventually you rise, weak and jabbering with madness, destined to wander the castle in a state of physical and mental ruin, unrecognisable to any who once knew you..."
This is a printed, perfect bound softback book, and includes a free PDF version. The Death Book is designed to fit perfectly into the Collectors Box.
Original Soundtrack - £5.00
Whether you prefer your atmospheric dungeon-synth on cassette or MP3, you simply haven't played Escape the Dark Castle until you've played it to this!

This atmospheric soundtrack was specially composed by Escape the Dark Castle co-designer and illustrator Alex Crispin to perfectly accompany gameplay. 
(not final design)
Contains: 
Over 45 mins of atmospheric music on limited edition Cassette, and the MP3 files to download. 
Become a Prisoner - £65.00
Back by popular demand, our incredible game artist Alex Crispin will hand draw your exclusive prisoner portrait, fully playable using the dice of whichever core game character you choose to become. 

Will you be the Abbot, Tailor, Mason? Choose from any prisoner released to date. Imagine the satisfaction when you Escape the Dark Castle personally!
How it works: 
Pick the character you'd like to become, then send us a photo of yourself which meets our guidelines. You'll get two copies of the card - one to use and one to keep pristine or frame as a rare collectors item. 
Our £25k funding goal will cover the print run and associated logistical costs of this ambitious campaign. But, if we are fortunate enough to exceed that goal we'd like to offer you the following freebies and upgrades: 
(All stretch goal targets are in £ GBP)
At this level of funding, all backers will get the Escape the Dark Castle Original Soundtrack MP3 files to download free of charge. 
At this level of funding, all backers will get the new and improved Tales from the Dark book PDF file to download free of charge. 
At this level of funding, all backers will get The Death Book PDF file to download free of charge.
Naturally, the sleeves will be high quality regardless, but what we’d really love to do is upgrade them from the standard material to a matt finish. 
Our books will be a classy production, but if we reach this level of funding it will open up some more luxurious options and finishes to make the print editions of Both Tales from the Dark and The Death Book that little bit more special. 
 At this level of funding we'd like to replace the Health Tracker cubes in the Collector's Box with something more thematic. Little skulls perhaps...
The Collectors Box includes a 'first player' card we refer to as the 'torch'. Given the chance, we'd like to upgrade this to an object as standard. 
If you thought the Golden Axe was legendary, wait until you see what is perhaps the most influential relic the gaming world has even known - The Living Stone! We'll add this item card and its custom dice to the Collector's Box as standard. 
Escape the Dark Castle lends itself well to a tasteful companion app, to track health and play the soundtrack to augment the play experience. This will be free to all backers if we reach this level of funding, but may not deliver at the same time as the other items in this campaign. 
We can dream. While the best way to experience Escape the Dark Castle will always be on the tabletop, we can't deny the idea of making a digital version has massive appeal. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Is it ready to print?

Since this isn't our first campaign, we have that extra bit of insight and experience in taking products from idea to reality. We expect this campaign will run to time. 

We don't want to keep anyone waiting, so before we launched the campaign we made sure the artwork, design and development of all the products we are offering here was as far along as possible. 

Will the materials be good quality?

Our manufacturing partner Dofine Games did an amazing job producing the Escape the Dark Castle to our demanding standards. We're glad to say we will be working with Dofine again so we can be sure to maintain the Themeborne quality standard - and maybe even push it a little higher,. 

Will it ever arrive?

We'll be working with our expert fulfillment partner Gamesquest to make sure your game is delivered promptly and with expert care. 

We're ready for this, we've done it before and everything is where it needs to be. All we need now is a cracking campaign to see it through.

We appreciate your support!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

"WAAA! IT TOOK LONG ENOUGH FOR WALUIGI TO GET HIS OWN BOOK. IT CONTAINS ALL THERE IS TO KNOW ABOUT WALUIGI."
Even the things we'd rather not know...?
"ESPECIALLY THOSE!"
"WALUIGI FEELS PHILOSOPHICAL TODAY. WHAT IS WALUIGI? WHY IS WALUIGI?"
This twisted take on that beloved blighter Waluigi began with my gaming parody webcomic, Brawl in the Family. Waluigi occasionally "took over" the web page, supplying his own bizarre comics and japes for a brief time (usually on April Fools Day). Although BitF ended in 2014, Waluigi apparently lives on, having now created an entire book dedicated to his tomfoolery.
Make no mistake either--"TOO BAD. WALUIGI TIME" isn't a compilation of past comics, but a hardcover tome full of new content. We're talking 200 brand, spanking new strips, plus the original set of 50 (or so) Waluigi comics from the BitF days for context.
The new strips will mostly center around Waluigi having brand new adventures and experiencing life in that uniquely inscrutable way. Waluigi's world seems to be a bizarre amalgam of modern life and the Mushroom Kingdom. He'll fly a kite, sit on a guy, attempt to make eggs, take up a job at the DMV, study Japanese, sing karaoke, invade a variety of classic animated films, and that's just for starters.
In addition, there are several brand new multi-comic story arcs for those days when one shot of Waluigi just isn't enough...
There's even an ending sequence wrapping everything up, with a few surprises along the way! For instance, the art may subtly evolve as the book progresses and Waluigi's skill improves. While the comics are mostly one-offs and small storylines, there's going to be a narrative incorporated into it all to really make the book stand on its own as a story.
It doesn't stop there. Waluigi gets lazy from time to time so the comic-drawing duties may be passed onto his buddy Wario, who possesses a similarly obtuse sense of humor. Wario's a bit more cheerful yet juvenile, so his take on things can lead to interesti--
Wait, what's this? It appears the crew from Brawl in the Family has pulled a little April Fools prank themselves and planned for some revenge! That's right, it's a little BitF bonus takeover, square in the middle of Waluigi's own book: "Back in the Family!" Between fifteen and twenty brand new Brawl in the Family-style comics will be included! Here's a Star Allies-themed one:
On top of all that, you can expect the same level of polish that Brawl in the Family: Volumes One, Two and Three had, with included Characters pages, Comic Directories, Special Thanks (with a twist!) and more.
"WAIT, THESE COINS AREN'T JUST GOING INTO WALUIGI'S POCKET? YOU ARE A TERRIBLE BUSINESSMAN."
The $25,000 goal breaks down as such--
$8,000 minimum for the book's physical creation
$7,000 for taxes
$3,000 for shipping costs
$2,500 for initial Kickstarter and credit card fees
That leaves about $4,500 for the artist to conceptualize and draw up the entire book. But I wouldn't complain if we got more, and that's what the Stretch Goals are for!
 "THE GIFT OF WALUIGI SHOULD BE PLENTY ALREADY!"
Waluigi may be a bitter blighter, but he takes care of his fans. If you can convert your love for Waluigi into a dollar amount, you'll be sure to find some purple rewards fit for royalty.
If you just want the basics, $15 will net you all the content but none of the atoms, with the digital book! $39 is the most affordable, direct way to get the book itself with no strings attached.
At $54, your book will contain a signature and sketch from some guy named Matthew Taranto, while the $74 tier grants you a permanent spot in everyone's books in the Special Thanks section! And this Thanks is even more Special than before--it's actually a part of the book's narrative!
There are two tiers that double your Waluigi pleasure with two copies of the book: $77 for just the books, or $144 for both with a pair of signature/sketches and Special Thanks names!
If you're the type that dons eggplant-colored overalls every weekend, you won't want to miss out on the top tiers: $94 delivers all of the above, plus your very own fan-art of Waluigi will be featured in all copies of the book! And finally, at $299, that fan-art will get its own unique page in every book, AND a full in-book critique by Waluigi himself!
And don't worry if you don't draw much--Waluigi's tastes are refined to the point where he can appreciate even the most Dada-esque attempts at capturing his glorious visage. But I can't promise he won't be...y'know, devastating.
"WALUIGI IS READY TO GO ALL OUT WITH THIS BOOK. IT WILL MAKE THE BRAWL IN THE FAMILY BOOKS LOOK LIKE HUMORLESS GARBAGE. WAAAHAHAHA!!"
Timepiece 1 Cleared: GOAL REACHED
The initial goal is $25,000, and we reached it in less than three days. Huzzah! Now this vile, eggplant-colored Tome of Eternal Darkness will become a reality thanks to you fantastic fans. Clear up some space on your shelf, because the rest of your books won't want to be anywhere near this thing!
Timepiece 2 Cleared: BONUS ART PIECES
This stretch goal will graft several new pages right into the book, each one adorned with a full-color new image of Waluigi in a particular style. Ever wanted to see Waluigi drawn in the style of Final Fantasy's Yoshitaka Amano, Garfield's Jim Davis or The Simpsons' Matt Groening? ...No? Well, you will anyway with this tier, so prepare those eyeballs!
Timepiece 3 Cleared: QUALITY BOOST
The now-classic Quality Boost stretch goal will spiffy up the books to the same degree as the past Brawl in the Family volumes. That means 1) heavier, higher-quality paper, 2) a shiny, foil title on the cover, 3) new inside cover art, and 4) stronger book binding to ensure if can take a beating. In short, the book gets stronger and prettier from this level-up.
Timepiece 4: NEW WALUIGI SONG
If you're the type that listened to A Wallelujah Chorus on repeat all month, Q-Tip those ears, because we've got more glorious Waluigi music coming your way. Hitting this goal means a new musical Waluigi cover will hit YouTube sometime soon for all to enjoy!
Timepiece 5: MORE BACK IN THE FAMILY COMICS
Get ready for a little extra splash of blue! If reached, this goal will add more brand new "Back in the Family" comics to the book, bringing the total number of them to a solid 30! I'll have to work overtime to come up with what's essentially 2 full months of BitF, but at 60k, I'm certainly willing to do that. While Waluigi is less-enthused about this goal, that's fine--he's got the rest of the book to himself already.
Timepiece 6: ANOTHER NEW WALUIGI SONG
Mini-rewards means many rewards! As part of our "last week" promotion, the Stretch Goals have gone into overdrive with bonuses every $5,000! 65k is no exception, prepping a second new Waluigi song for everyone.
Timepiece 7: A THIRD NEW WALUIGI SONG
The hits just keep on coming! A third Waluigi musical cover will show up prior to the book's release if this goal is reached, bringing the grand total of Waluigi songs on BitFinity's YouTube to five. That's one for every weekday to listen to for the rest of your life!
Timepiece 8: ALL SMASH CHARACTERS WALUIGI-FIED
Remember how BitF Volume One contained that large, double-page art of all the Super Smash Bros. Brawl characters? This would be kinda like that...but weirder. It's my attempt to "Waluigi-fy" every member of the cast, from Alph to Zero Suit Samus! Note that this doesn't mean every character will be sporting a long nose and spindly mustache, but rather that they'll each have very exaggerated, offbeat features like Waluigi. It's sure to be one of the most bizarre things seen by mankind, so let's make it happen!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
If funded, I'll aim to make this new book match the quality of my past comic books: Brawl in the Family: Volumes One, Two and Three, so that fans can have something to be proud of on their bookshelves. With Kickstarters, however, the possibility of complications is always there, so there might be unforeseeable circumstances may arise that might cause the book to arrive later than its estimated completion date. That said, I do feel that all of these goals--delivery date included--are very reasonable and I'll do my best to deliver the highest quality product as quickly as possible.

campaign.story:
We've made it to our initial funding target - Thank you!! 

If this is your first visit to this KickStarter * Hi * just scroll down to the introduction section and read all about our project :D

This top section is now dedicated to our Stretch goals...
Muju Spirit House No.6 - LOCKED
LOCKED - 8K Stretch goal
So here it is... the mystery 6th Spirit House!

A full reveal of this sculpture and a production run of this Spirit House will be unlocked if we reach our £8,000 stretch goal.  
Hi .  My name is Miss Muju, and I'm an artist based in St Ives, Cornwall, UK.  My partner and I set up the Muju Studio here 8 years ago, as a studio by the beach seemed like a good plan!  We are both artists, with a shared love of nature, photography, travel, and most of all creating immersive worlds.  
Mr Muju produces drawings, paintings and prints of an imaginary dimension - Mujuworld.   
I take inspiration from this world and bring the characters to life through sculptures. 
I've been producing limited edition resin figures for the past 7 years, and I'm committed to self-producing all my work, using sustainable materials wherever possible.  

With your help over the years I've been able to release some classic Muju characters, including the Tree Spirit and the Star Traveller.  It's been an amazing creative journey since my first KickStarter in 2013, and now I'm back with my latest creations to share with you!
You can see more of our work on our website : www.mujuworld.co.uk 
Miss Muju sculpting
Mujuworld has always been a place full of buildings and landscapes that are as alive as the Muju characters which inhabit the world. 
Mujuworld illustrations
The idea of bringing some of the Muju architecture to life in 3D has been in the background for a long time, with Mr Muju often asking me to make him a building or two for his desk.
I finally got around to sculpting one, and found myself instantly in love with mini architecture. One design then became five Muju Spirit Houses, and as I couldn't stop there, the next step had to be sculpting a Muju Temple.
Muju Spirit House sculpts ready for moulding
The Forest Temple is my most ambitious and complex sculpture to date, and includes details like the temple guardian cat, some standing stones, and a tiny cosmic owl perched on the temple treetop.   
After many months of pre-production work, I'm finally ready to share these new sculptures with you. 
Muju Forest Temple Sculpture
This project is well underway, as we've already produced the original sculptures, and have one working mould for each design.  Using these moulds we have created the prototypes featured in our KickStarter film.  But now we need to invest in an in-house production run of these sculptures.
The pre-production costs involved in releasing a new sculpture are high. We cast our sculptures in bio-resin, which is a non-toxic and more sustainable material than traditional resin. However it's significantly more expensive than polyurethane resin. Bio-resin is also a harder material to work with than standard resin, and takes much longer to set, only allowing one cast per day.  So more moulds need to be made of each sculpture to increase our daily casting rate.
This project requires more investment than previous sculptures I've released, as I am hoping to create my first ever Muju mini series to accompany the Forest Temple sculpture.  This will involve producing multiple moulds for every Spirit House as well as the Forest Temple to enable us to increase our production rate.  
Each Forest Temple and Spirit House sculpture is totally handmade and hand-painted by ourselves, which also requires a big investment of our time.

Pre-order sales through this KickStarter campaign will enable us to fund a production run of this handmade sculpture series.
Muju Postcard Set
The first reward tier is for a set of 3 Muju postcards. 
These postcards feature all 3 main elements of this Kickstarter campaign... The Forest Temple, the Spirit House illustration, and the Spirit House sculptures. 

You will also get access to all our backer updates throughout the campaign and beyond, so you can follow our progress from start to finish :)
Muju Spirit House Enamel Pin Design
The second reward tier is for a Muju Spirit House enamel pin badge    
Size: 3.5cm (1.4") tall
Muju Happy Hills
The Happy Hills reward will get you a pair of mini happy hill sculptures - one in each design.  The hills stand 2cm tall and will come in a random selection of colours.  See below for some example pairs: 
Examples of the 2 x Happy Hill rewards
Muju Spirit Houses - Limited Edition Print
With this reward tier you will receive one 'Muju Spirit House' giclée fine art limited edition print.  Signed and numbered by Mr Muju.
Print size: 30 x 21cm (11.7 x 8.3") 
Edition size: 50
Muju Spirit Houses
Spirit House reward tiers:
The Spirit House sculptures stand between 5-6cm tall ( approx. 2").  Each one is hand cast and painted by us in the Muju Studio.
There are multiple reward tiers for the Spirit Houses. You can chose from one Spirit House, up to all five.  However many you decide to pledge for, you will be able to pick which designs you would like.  We will send out a backer survey after the Kickstarter has ended, and ask you to choose your Spirit Houses then :)
Spirit House 1
Spirit House 2
Spirit House 3
Spirit House 4
Spirit House 5
Muju Forest Temple Sculpture
Muju Forest Temple reward tier:
Receive one Forest Temple sculpture, which stands 18cm tall ( approx. 7").
Each sculpture is individually hand cast, finished and painted by us in the Muju Studio.  
Forest Temple Sculpture Details
This reward tier is for the Forest Temple complete set !
This set will include:
- 2 x Happy Hill mini sculptures
- 3 x Muju Postcards
- 1 x Muju Spirit House Ltd edition print
- 5 x Spirit Houses (1 of each design )
- 1 x Forest Temple sculpture
The Cosmic Owl on the Forest Temple treetop
The Forest Temple Collection
The final reward is for a one-off Forest Temple collection, encased in a glass dome display stand. 
Each Spirit House sculpture in this scene sits atop its own Happy Hill. 
The Forest Temple is a one-of-a-kind version which has been sculpted to stand 22cm tall (9") tall.
The glass dome display stands 27cm tall and 14cm diameter (11 x 5.5").
Forest Temple scene details
A look inside the glass display dome
If you want to add-on any extras to your chosen reward you can! 
How do I do that? 
You can adjust your pledge amount at any point to add extras to your reward options. Simply click the "manage your pledge" button here on the page, and then you can increase your pledge by the desired amount, without having to change your selected reward tier. 
Here's some example options:
Add £8 to your pledge = receive a Spirit House enamel pin badge (as well as your chosen reward) 
Add £15 = receive 2 mini Happy Hills with your selected reward tier
Add £20 = receive a Muju Print with your reward.
Add £25 = Get an extra Spirit House of your choice 
After the campaign ends I will send out a survey to each backer to finalise what you want to add-on.  This will make sure you get exactly what you pledged for.
If you have any questions about add-on options you can message me for more details!

Thanks for taking the time to check out this KickStarter campaign.  Remember to share this project on social media if you like it - every share really does help :)

Finally, if you want to see daily updates from the Muju Studio you can find us on Instagram : @miss_muju + @mr_muju

With the help of the Kickstarter community we have been able to produce a number of Muju sculptures in the past. 
We now have 5 successful campaigns to draw experience from, and we will be using all we've learned from these different projects to ensure this one is a success. 

The risks and challenges in completing this project are minimal. We have already reached the stage in production where the original sculpts are complete, and we have made the first silicone mould for each design featured in this campaign.

We have set realistic goals for the production times of the different rewards in this KickStarter. We will also vary the delivery dates on the rewards to allow us time to fulfil all the reward pledges within a reasonable time frame.

We will also keep all our backers updated with the production process so they know when to expect their rewards to arrive. 

With your help we are ready to bring these sculptures to life :)

updates.update_userinfo: The Final Update - New Muju Kickstarter !
updates.update_content:
Wow - we have a double celebration today!   

Not only did we make it to the end of our campaign & are now fully funded, but also we reached our stretch goal in the final minutes of the KickStarter  :D

Hey everyone,  
We've just got back from ToyCon UK, and really enjoyed being able to show our prototype Forest Temple and Spirit Houses at this event last weekend. 
Thanks to everyone who came by our booth, and who've since backed our KickStarter :)

People often ask me what I make my original sculptures out of, and what techniques & tools I use.  I work with firm Super Sculpey, and my favourite tools are a scalpel and pins for etching details.  

Here's a little bonus video for you showing some of the Forest Temple sculpting process:

Hey everyone!
Well here we are, about to begin day 3 of our Forest Temple KickStarter.

We can't believe that we made our initial funding target in under 6 hours! 
You guys have blown us away with your amazing support for this project :D

So the Forest Temple and Spirit House release is really going to happen, and that's thanks to all of you who got behind this project straight away!

                          The game components are language independent, the rulebook will be included in 4 languages: English, French, German and Hungarian. The latest rules are available on our homepage: 
http://a-games.hu/en/games/prehistory.html
Note: The rulebooks are subject to change in the final product. Some of them are under translation.
Additional languages: As the game is language-independent, it is possible to make additional rulebooks for download. At least 2 proofreader and translator needed per language (Link). If there is sufficient interest, we will even produce a printed version.
Shipping is a great challenge as always. The product should arrive on time, in mint condition and without exorbitant shipping costs. With our new process we can make sure we will have our packages properly handled. The whole fulfillment process will be controlled by us (A-games). Meaning:
Proper packaging with infill.
Full tracking on all packages.
Faster processing time.
Insurance on all packages.
Reasonable prices.
Shipping is pricy for all projects especially, if we have a complex big-box game. But we intend to keep the cost reasonable for our backers, so we cover the shipping cost partially for you (20-50% depending on your location). Your part of the shipping cost will be added automatically to your pledge amount based on your location. We are using a solution where you will not be charged with additional fees in the EU, US, Canada and Australia. For other regions in some cases you may expect additional customs charges depending on your local regulations, but we and our shipping partners will make sure to keep these cases and the fees as low as possible. Please send us a private message, if you need more than 1 copy.
FREE Essen pickup (25th - 28th of October, 2018): As in previous years, we will have a booth again this year during the Essen Spiel. We invite you to come to our booth and pick up your games personally. 
FREE Budapest pickup: In Hungary you will also have a chance to pick up your copies personally on the following places:
A-gameshop: 1161 Budapest, Rákosi út 93.
Pince klub:  1041 Budapest, István út 14.
Társasjátékok Ünnepe - Lurdy ház

Risks and challenges
We are aware that producing a game is a great challenge with many tasks. This will be our 6th released game overall and we already had a few successful crowdfunding projects on Kickstarter also. Both Ave Roma and Sakura were recent successes. Every time a few new lessons were learned from the campaigns, we are sure we have an even better process for the packaging and delivery of our games worldwide.

During the campaign all the graphics, rules and minor fixes will be finalized for Prehistory. Our main manufacturing partner is located in Poland and they have plenty of experience with several large publishers already. We are certain that we will have high quality components produced as they proved their professionalism with the second print of Ave Roma and Sakura in the past. Shortly after the campaign ends, the game will be in production (estimated in April). The fulfillment will be fully controlled by our company to make sure top notch quality is produced. For the freight shipping we will use our usual partner Kuehne + Nagel. We are planning the fulfillment start for the middle of the summer, so the deadline of October is only a worst-case scenario.

We want to keep you updated with all the relevant information about the progress of the project. We are confident to give you the best possible product and support. :)

Dear backers,
It’s been a while since our last Kickstarter project. Now, we are getting closer to a new campaign. Our newest complex board game project called Impression is coming to Kickstarter on 15th of September. Until that we would like to post more info about it from time to time (on Facebook, BGG, A-games site). Now, in short, what you can expect:
What is Impression?

Dear backers,
We would like to contact you to make some small post campaign update and start a new system. Today and in the following 1-2 days we will finish sending out the last batch of replacement components and/or partial refunds to those who have cases connected to our games. If you already contacted us and our team gave you confirmation about recording your case, it should be resolved already or soon will be.

Dear backers,
We were fairly busy lately with the fulfillment, but now everything is on track again. After a short pause we continue. On Saturday a new batch already left our warehouse and others follow.
